Hier erfährst du, mit welchen einfachen Schritten du dein N26 Bankkonto schließen kannst. Wenn du ein Premiumkonto hast, kannst du auch einfach auf ein Standard Konto wechseln, statt dein Konto komplett zu kündigen (neuen Tab).Wenn du dir aber sicher bist, dass du dein N26 Girokonto komplett kündigen möchtest, folge bitte diesen Schritten:Wenn du noch Geld auf deinem Girokonto hast, solltest du es zuerst auf ein anderes Konto überweisen. Wenn dein Kontostand negativ ist, musst du Geld auf dein Konto laden (neuen Tab). Kündige dein N26 Girokonto erst, wenn dein Gesamtsaldo null ist – das macht den Prozess sehr viel einfacher.Klicke hier (neuen Tab), um die online Kontokündigung anzufangen (neuen Tab). Du musst dich anmelden, um deine Identität zu verifizieren. Die Anwendung leitet dich dann durch die Kontoschließung.Zerstöre deine Bankkarte – zum Beispiel, indem du sie mit einer Schere zerschneidest. Du solltest den Chip sowie den Magnetstreifen zerstören. Entsorge die Teile separat.Probleme mit der Kontoschließung?Wenn du eine italienische IBAN hast oder dich nicht einloggen kannst, sende uns bitte eine E-Mail an (neuen Tab)support@n26.com (neuen Tab) – direkt von der E-Mail-Adresse, die du bei der Registration für dein N26 Konto verwendet hast. Hänge der E-Mail dieses Kündigungsschreiben (neuen Tab) an. Im Formular müssen folgende Informationen beinhaltet sein:Einen Antrag für die Schließung des N26 Kontos zu einem bestimmten Datum oder “so bald wie möglich”,dein Name,deine N26 IBAN,solltest du noch Geld auf dem Konto haben: eine andere IBAN aus dem SEPA-Raum, auf den wir dein Restguthaben überweisen können.

question: Shared Spaces - Trusted Beneficiary
answer:
A trusted beneficiary of a Shared Space can:Transfer money from their own Spaces (including other Shared Spaces of which they are a participant) to a Shared Space. Access and freely transfer the funds of a Shared Space at any time.Leave a Shared Space at any time.Transfers between a trusted beneficiary and a Shared Space do not need to be authenticated via Pin and Push notification. This means that beneficiaries can seamlessly drag-and-drop money via the N26 app and Web app similarity to how normal Space transactions work.
Why do I need to classify an owner or member as a trusted beneficiary?European banking law regulates how bank transfers must be authorised. In this law strong customer authentication (SCA) is a requirement to make online payments more secure. One exception to this is the classification of a person in a Shared Space as a “trusted beneficiary” so that transfers to this person do not require SCA.Learn moreWhat are Shared Spaces?How to add or remove Shared Space participants?

question: How to cancel my N26 premium membership?
answer: N26 Smart, N26 You or N26 Metal contracts have an initial term of one year with an automatic renewal after the first 12 months, and then move to an indefinite contract term. You can choose to stop this automatic renewal at any time during the first 12 months of your contract.After this renewal, the contract becomes indefinite - but you can cancel your membership at any time.In this article you will find the difference between revocation, cancellation of the membership and cancellation of the renewal of your membership. You have 3 options:Revoke your membership within the 14-day revocation period (this is a legal time frame, you can request this by contacting us).Stop your membership renewal at any time before the end of the first 12-month contract by contacting us via chat.Cancel your membership at any time (you can cancel immediately at any time without limitation by contacting us via chat).Premium to Premium downgradeIf you want, you’re now able to downgrade to another Premium account without having to downgrade to Standard, and so keeping all your Spaces, round-up rules, income sorter, and existing card and payments.To do so, login to your mobile app, go to My Account and open your Membership details. Select Modify Membership and you’ll then be able to choose another Premium Membership that suits your needs. RevocationYou can revoke your membership within the 14-day revocation period. This period starts as soon as the first monthly fee is charged. Simply contact us and we'll assist you from there. If you revoke any of our Premium membership tiers, you will be able to upgrade again to the same or another tier.Stop the renewal of your membershipYour N26 premium membership has an initial 12-month contract period.  At the end of the first 12 months the membership will automatically renew and move to an indefinite contract period, unless you contact us and ask to stop the renewal.You can request this at any time before your 12-month renewal date, and we’ll notify you of the renewal via email 8 weeks before your anniversary date.If you choose to stop your renewal, you can continue to use your N26 Mastercard and all your premium membership benefits until your membership expires. That means you’ll keep your insurance coverage (for N26 You and N26 Metal) for as long as you’re still required to pay your membership fee. After that, a Virtual card will be issued to you on the contract anniversary date immediately upon downgrade. There is a minimum balance requirement of €10. No need to contact us about it, it will be processed automatically.Cancel your membership at any timeIf you want to terminate your membership at any time after the 14-day revocation period, please contact us. If you choose this option with N26 You or N26 Metal, your insurance benefits will stop and your Smart, You and Metal Premium cards will also be deactivated.If you want to definitely close your account, visit our article How to close my N26 account.FAQs about the N26 Premium subscription cancellationDo I have to close my account to cancel my Premium subscription?No, you can simply change your subscription in the N26 app and your new account will be set up immediately.What happens to my IBAN if I cancel my Premium subscription?Changing your subscription does not affect your bank details, so your IBAN will remain unchanged.

question: How to repay my loan early?
answer: You can always repay your N26 Credit loan early. Keep in mind that an early repayment fee of up to 1% applies. If your remaining credit period is less than 12 months, the fee is up to 0.5% of the prematurely repaid amount.Contact us via chat to request an early repayment and we’ll provide you with an exact calculation of the early repayment fee.*The above only applies to loans with N26. For auxmoney (+49 211 737 100 020) or Younited Credit (+33 1 78 42 53 99) loans, please contact the appropriate partner directly.

question: Chargeback: Häufig gestellte Fragen zu Reklamationen
How long does it take to send money with Wise?
answer: Once you've initiated your transfer via Wise you'll be given an estimated time frame. When making a transfer, ensure that the recipients name exactly matches the name on their bank account! If a Wise transfer fails, we’ll notify you via push message. The amount will automatically be returned to your account a few days later.You can't personally cancel a transfer, but if you get in touch with Wise support this way they can cancel the transfer for you. Keep in mind that the transfer can only be cancelled up until the point Wise pays out your funds. Once the money has been sent to the recipient, it's not possible to cancel the transfer anymore.The recipients details can only be changed up until the point that Wise has paid out your money. After your money has been paid out, the recipients details can no longer be changed. You can get in touch with Wise this way.Wise doesn’t charge extra fees for a returned payment and neither do we. However, some participating banks do charge fees, in which case Wise will deduct this amount from the money returned under their Conditions of Use (new tab).Common reasons for a failed transfer:Error in the transfer details (for example, when entering the recipient’s name or account information).Special characters or too many characters in the recipient’s name or reference field.Limits have been reached or online payments aren’t active in card settings.Foreign currency transfers aren’t possible with N26 Business or N26 Business You or if the recipient is a business account.

question: Warum wurde mir etwas doppelt berechnet?
answer: Wir bieten dir Banking in Echtzeit. Das bedeutet, dass du immer siehst, was in deinem Konto passiert. Es gibt zwei Transaktionsarten, die bei einem Kauf in einem Geschäft oder im Internet stattfinden:Autorisierungen: Ein Betrag, der von einem Einzelhändler oder Verkäufer blockiert oder reserviert wird. Das kann alles Mögliche sein – von der morgendlichen Tasse Kaffee bis hin zu Hotel- oder Mietwagenbuchungen (einschließlich Kautionen).Buchungen: Der tatsächliche Betrag, der von deinem Konto abgeht. Die Tasse Kaffee wurde endgültig von deinem Konto abgebucht, du hast deine Kaution nach dem Auschecken im Hotel zurückerhalten oder das Auto unversehrt zurückgegeben.Sobald eine Autorisierung bestätigt wird, können wir sie nicht mehr stornieren oder rückgängig machen. Danach passiert eins dieser drei Dinge: Die Autorisierung wird zu einer Buchung, sie wird abgelehnt oder sie verfällt (und kehrt nach spätestens 12 Tagen automatisch auf dein Konto zurück. Bei Kautionen für Autovermietungen kann es bis zu 30 Werktage dauern.) Bitte beachte:Manchmal siehst du sowohl die Autorisierung als auch die endgültige Buchung, wenn es am Zahlungsterminal technische Probleme gibt oder die Verbindung während des Vorgangs unterbrochen wurde. Aber keine Sorge – am Ende erlischt die Autorisierung. Wenn das nach 12 Tagen noch nicht passiert ist, helfen wir dir dabei, dein Geld zurückzubekommen (neuen Tab).Autorisierungen für Verifizierungen sind in der Regel sehr kleine Beträge, mit denen geprüft wird, ob deine Karte aktiv ist (z.B. im Google Play Store). Dieses Geld wird auf dein Konto zurücküberwiesen.Die Höhe einer Autorisierung kann aus verschiedenen Gründen (neuen Tab) von der endgültigen Buchung abweichen.

question: How to give feedback or suggest a new product?
answer: We frequently send short surveys to review feedback but participation is voluntary and anonymous. For individual questions or suggestions, you can send us your feedback to ideas@n26.com (new tab). We’re always grateful if you can take a minute or two to help us get even better.And if you ever feel dissatisfied with one of our products or services, you can also file a complaint.

question: Dónde encontrar su identificación fiscal
answer: Tu Número de Identificación Fiscal (NIF) es único para ti y lo expiden las autoridades fiscales cuando te registras en el país en el que eres contribuyente.Dónde encontrar tu NIF puede variar dependiendo del país en el que estás sujeto al pago de impuestos. Te advertimos de que el nombre del NIF de cada país puede variar. Por ejemplo, si eres del Reino Unido, tu NIF es como tu número de la Seguridad Social (NIN).Dónde encontrar tu NIF para residentes alemanes:Si resides en Alemania y te registraste en la agencia tributaria local, se te proporcionará un NIF o Steueridentifikationsnummer de 11 dígitos. No lo confundas con tu número fiscal o Steuernummer de 9 dígitos.Aunque los NIF no se indican en los documentos de identidad oficiales, podrás encontrarlo en los siguientes lugares:La carta que recibiste de la Agencia Federal Tributaria Central que emite tu NIF o IdNr (Mitteilungsschreiben über die Zuordnung einer Identifikationsnummer).Liquidación del IRPFDomiciliación de la nóminaSi quieres más información sobre tu NIF o si necesitas solicitarlo, puedes obtener más información aquí (pestaña nueva).Dónde encontrar tu NIF para residentes franceses:Si resides en Francia y estás obligado a hacer la declaración de la renta allí, la Agencia Tributaria francesa te expedirá un NIF o SPI (Simplification des Procédures d'Imposition) de 13 dígitos en cuanto te hayas registrado en la base de datos de la Agencia Tributaria. Estos números empiezan por 0, 1, 2 o 3.Encontrarás el NIF en los siguientes lugares:En el formulario preimpreso de la declaración de la rentaAdemás, puedes encontrarlo en las notificaciones fiscales y del impuesto sobre bienes inmueblesSi quieres más información sobre tu NIF o si necesitas solicitarlo, puedes obtener más información aquí (pestaña nueva).Dónde encontrar tu NIF para residentes italianos:Si resides en Italia, el NIF o Codice fiscale (que consta de 16 caracteres) solo será válido si está inscrito en el Registro Tributario italiano administrado por la Agencia Tributaria italiana (Agenzia delle Entrate). Si no tienes NIF, deberás solicitarlo en cualquiera de las oficinas de la Agencia Tributaria italiana.Aunque los NIF no se indican en los documentos de identidad oficiales, podrás encontrarlo en los siguientes lugares:El NIF se encuentra en tu tarjeta sanitaria personal (Número de Identificación Fiscal, Tessera sanitaria/Codice fiscale).También encontrarás tu NIF en tu tarjeta NIF.Si quieres más información sobre tu NIF o si necesitas solicitarlo, puedes obtener más información aquí (pestaña nueva).Dónde encontrar tu NIF para residentes españoles:Si resides en España, tu NIF es único a efectos fiscales y aduaneros. Tu NIF español está compuesto por nueve caracteres (el último carácter es una letra de control). Los NIF los expide el Ministerio del Interior y pueden variar dependiendo de si eres una persona física con nacionalidad española o no.Encontrarás tu NIF en los siguientes lugares dependiendo de tu situación:Documento Nacional de IdentidadDNI electrónicoTarjeta de Identidad de ExtranjeroNuevo permiso de conducir (desde 2004)Tarjeta de Identificación FiscalTarjeta de la Seguridad SocialSi quieres más información sobre tu NIF o si necesitas solicitarlo, puedes obtener más información aquí (pestaña nueva).Información importante:El formato de identificación fiscal que puedes introducir en tu app N26 dependerá del país en el que residas. Es decir, que si resides en Alemania, deberás introducir tu NIF alemán.Puedes consultar la información fiscal que hayas guardado en tu cuenta accediendo a:Mi cuenta > Información personal > Información fiscal.Si has introducido el país en el que estás sujeto a impuestos pero no tu NIF, elimina este país de la lista que se te muestra en la app, vuelve a introducir el país e introduce tu NIF de nuevo.Puedes consultar más información sobre qué hacemos con tus datos fiscales aquí (pestaña nueva).

question: Where does N26 invest my money?
answer: We strive to provide our clients' deposits for loans to our customers (provided that they have the appropriate credit rating). For the liquidity not required in the customer business, our investment strategy is low in risk.We invest our customers' money at short notice with the Deutsche Bundesbank and other European banks in the eurozone with only good risk classes. And we refinance public-law customers mainly in Germany (cities and municipalities) and invest in euro government bonds.We're not a trading book institute. That is: we do not trade for short-term profit.And we don't engage in speculation, whether on food, foreign exchange, bitcoins or other asset classes.

question: Comment puis-je commander une carte additionnelle ?
answer: Cliquez ici, si vous souhaitez remplacer une carte, plutôt que de commander une carte additionnelle.Comment commander une carte additionnelle:Connectez-vous à votre compte N26Accédez à : DécouvrirChoisissez : Carte additionnelle > MastercardChoisissez le coloris de votre choix et le mode de livraisonCliquez sur : Valider et payerLa carte additionnelle coûte 10 € avec un envoi standard et 25 € avec une livraison express. Pour déclencher la production et l’envoi de la carte, le solde de votre compte doit être de 10 € minimum. Vous pouvez obtenir plus d’informations ici.ℹ️ La carte additionnelle est disponible pour les clients avec une adhésion prémium (N26 Smart, N26 You, N26 Metal, N26 Business Smart, N26 Business You, N26 Business Metal) dans les pays suivants : Allemagne, France, Italie, Espagne, Autriche, Danemark, Islande, Liechtenstein, Norvège, Pologne, Suède, Belgique, Estonie, Finlande, Grèce, Irlande, Lettonie, Lituanie, Luxembourg, Portugal, Slovaquie, Slovénie, Pays-Bas.

question: How to report an insurance claim?
answer: Your N26 You (new tab) and N26 Metal (new tab) membership includes a wide range of insurance benefits, covered by our partner Allianz Global Assistance Europe.*To report a claim, log into your app, go to 👤 My Account > Your membership > Allianz Insurance Coverage, then select Make a claim.There you'll find:A guide to submit your claim (for example, flight or luggage delay, extended warranty, or travel cancellation)Your account and contract information, including your Allianz policy numberThe option to contact Allianz directly in the case of a medical emergencyFor emergencies, please have the following information ready:The full address and telephone number of your current locationNames of all official contacts (doctors, hospitals, and/or police)An exact description of the situation*Allianz Global Assistance Europe is a trading name of AWP P&C S.A. - Dutch branch, and a member of the Allianz Group.

question: How to upgrade to Metal?
answer: Available in Germany, Austria, France, Spain, Italy, Belgium, Estonia, Finland, Greece, Ireland, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Poland, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Iceland, Liechtenstein.N26 Metal is available during initial sign-up, or by upgrading in the mobile app if you already have a N26 bank account, N26 Smart or a N26 You membership. To upgrade to N26 Metal from the mobile app, simply go to the Explore tab and select Get N26 Metal. and choose between a Charcoal Black, Quartz Rose, or Slate Grey card.Check the conditions of the delivery and accept the N26 Metal T&Cs (new tab). Once you confirm your request by entering your Confirmation PIN, your new card will be on the way.Standard deliveries take up to 15 business days.If you upgrade to N26 Business Metal from another membership, the monthly fee of €16,90 will be deducted directly from your N26 account every month starting on the date of your upgrade. If you’re a new customer that signed up to N26 Metal, your membership will be active as soon as the first fee was charged. This happens when you topped-up your account to cover the first monthly fee, but at the latest 15 days after you proved your identity. From then on, you’ll be charged your monthly fee on the same date every month.All purchases and travel booked using your N26 You Mastercard will remain insured.If you’re already a N26 You member, you don’t have to pay the fees for the N26 You membership on top.You can purchase an extra N26 You card for a one-off fee of 10€ through your N26 app.

question: How to split shared expenses with MoneyBeam?
answer:
Eligibility: Available for EU Standard and Premium customers iOS. Android to be available in the coming weeks.Split the billWith our latest “Split the bill” feature, you can easily split shared expenses amongst friends and family using your N26 app. From splitting the bill at a restaurant to chipping in for a birthday gift, you can use it for any kind of purchase where you’re sharing the cost with others. You can even split the cost for home expenses, such as a utility bill or items for your home.For any card transaction you make, you have the option to split the bill evenly or enter custom amounts for each person who is contributing to the group purchase. You can split expenses with anyone, whether or not they are N26 customers.How to split the bill?You must use your N26 card to first make the purchase, then when you are ready to split the bill, follow the below steps:Following your purchase, open your N26 appFind the transaction on ‘Home’ tab, tap it and choose ‘Split the bill’Add the people you are splitting the cost with (for non-N26 customers, you’ll need to include their name)Once ready, tap the green button at the bottom of the screen to confirm the split amounts
Non-N26 customers will receive a message with your details and the amount you're requestingFinally tap ‘Confirm’ to send out the remaining requests to fellow N26 customers who will receive a request via MoneyBeamImportant:Requests to N26 customers: This will work just like a normal MoneyBeam request.Requests to non-N26 customers: You will receive a standard template with your IBAN details which you can edit. This can then be sent via any other messaging platform on your device (e.g. email, WhatsApp, Signal, etc.). Please note, these requests can’t be tracked in the app.View amount left to be paid: N26 customers and yourself will be able to see the total amount to split and how much of the total bill is left to be paid. If the total purchase amount does not equal the amount split, then you will see a warning message (but still have the option to continue anyway).Maximum of 20 open MoneyBeam requests: You can have up to 20 open MoneyBeam requests at any one time, and a maximum of 3 open requests with a single contact. If your limit has been reached, you will see a message explaining this.

question: How to order my card with express delivery?
answer: Express delivery is a good option if you need your card in a hurry or if postal deliveries have sometimes failed to reach you for whatever reason.You’ll be given the option to select express delivery when choosing a delivery method for your first card or if you reorder a card. You’ll then receive a tracking link by email. If you’re not home during the delivery and your mailbox can’t be accessed, the card will be left at a nearby access point (you can find it through the provided tracking link). The card only stays at the access point for a limited amount of time. After that, it’ll be returned to us. We’ll inform you by email if that happens.If you order via express delivery, keep in mind that:Your N26 Standard, Smart, You or N26 Metal card will be delivered within 3-5 working days. Deliveries take place between 08:00 and 12:00. Deliveries can be made by DHL express to all of our supported countries within Europe. It’s currently not possible to make deliveries to other countries.It’s not possible to cancel or change an express delivery once it’s been selected as the delivery method.If you chose express delivery and wish to close your account, you'll still need to pay the express delivery fee.If your card hasn’t arrived within 3-5 working days of placing your order, please check the tracking link for an update. You can also use the tracking link to inform DHL directly about the details of your delivery address or to redirect the shipment if you can’t be there at the time of delivery.How much does express delivery cost?N26 Standard, N26 Smart and N26 You cards:First card when opening your account: 25€Reordering your card: 30€Extra N26 Smart/ You card: 30€N26 Metal cards:First card when opening your account: 25€Reordering your card 65€

question: CRR Disclosure Report
answer: What is it ?The Capital Requirements Regulation (CRR) is an EU law. Among others, it states an obligation for credit institutions to publish a disclosure report on an annual basis (Art. 433 CRR).  Why is the Disclosure Report not published in our Support Center or somewhere else on our website?N26 Bank GmbH is not obliged to publish the CRR report on our website. Art. 434 (new tab) CRR only requires an “appropriate medium” and therefore leaves the decision up to each credit institution.N26 Bank GmbH publishes its CRR in www.bundesanzeiger.de (new tab)

question: How to contact N26?
answer:
There are several ways you can reach out to our customer support team, but the best option is always opening a secure chat while you’re logged into the App. This will allow us to verify your identity, and provide you with specific information and support.We are available every day from 07:00 to 23:00 CET, including Sundays and bank holidays.How to contact us through the AppHow to chat with usOpen a support chatThe chat will start once you’re logged inHow to call us
(only for Premium accounts)We can only connect you with our customer support team if you call us from the number registered in your account. If you need to register a new phone number, follow the steps in this page: How to change my phone number?Please note: to contact us by phone you need to have an N26 Premium account (You, Smart, or Metal).Call Support (Premium Only)Don’t have access to the App?Not an N26 customer yet?If you don’t have an account with us, but you have general questions about our products and services, you can either open a visitor chat below or send us an email to support@n26.com (wait time for email may be longer).Lost access to your account?Is your phone lost or broken? Are you having issues logging into the App and accessing your account? We are sorry to hear this and we will help you resolve your issue if you open a visitor chat below or send us an email to support@n26.com (wait time for email may be longer).Need to change your personal data? Follow the instructions in this page, How to change my phone number, address, or other personal data?Please note: for your safety, we can only help you with questions regarding personal data if you start a Support chat while you’re logged into the App.Open a visitor chatPlease note: We won’t be able to assist you in case you visit our location. Please only use our designated channels in order to contact us.

question: Comment utiliser les Espaces ?
answer: Pour utiliser vos espaces, accédez à la rubrique « Espaces » de votre application mobile N26 ou espace client en ligne. Dans la rubrique « Espaces », vous pouvez afficher, rejoindre et créer des Espaces.Créer un espace :Appuyez sur « Créer un nouvel espace » dans la rubrique « Espaces »Sélectionnez l’une des options suivantes :« Économiser pour un projet » : saisissez le montant de l’objectif d’épargne et la date cible (facultatif).« Économiser à plusieurs » : vous créez ainsi un « Espace Partagé ».« Créez-le maintenant, décidez plus tard » : créez simplement un espace auquel vous pourrez ajouter des objectifs ou des règles automatiques.Personnalisez ensuite votre espace avec un nom et une image.Vous disposez désormais d’un sous-compte espace pour mieux contrôler vos finances. Commençons maintenant à utiliser les « Espaces » !Déplacer de l’argent entre vos espaces :Maintenez enfoncé le bouton « compte courant » ou un autre espace.Puis déplacez votre argent vers l’espace souhaité.Vous pouvez ensuite confirmer le montant et le solde est immédiatement mis à jour.Verrouillez votre espace :Vous pouvez verrouiller et déverrouiller un sous-compte à tout moment depuis votre application mobile et espace client en ligne. Vous ne pouvez pas transférer de l’argent vers ou depuis un espace verrouillé.Accédez à l’espace que vous souhaitez verrouiller/déverrouiller.Appuyez sur « Gérer ».Appuyez ensuite sur « Verrouiller un sous-compte » ou « Déverrouiller un sous-compte ».Saisissez votre code de validation.Le sous-compte sera immédiatement verrouillé ou déverrouillé.Masquez le solde de votre espace :Pour masquer le solde de votre espace du solde total de votre compte :Allez dans l’espace dans lequel vous souhaitez masquer le solde.Appuyez sur l’icône en forme de roue dentée « Paramètres » (dans le coin supérieur droit).Sélectionnez « Masquer le solde de l’espace ».Gérez vos espaces :Vous pouvez créer des règles automatiques, des objectifs d’épargne et activer la fonctionnalité « Gérer les arrondis ». Dans l’espace, appuyez sur « Gérer » :Pour créer un objectif d’épargne, sélectionnez « Créer un objectif » (vous pouvez également le modifier ultérieurement).Saisissez simplement le montant de l’objectif et la date d’échéance, puis cliquez sur « Confirmer l’objectif ».Pour activer/désactiver les arrondis, sélectionnez « Gérer les arrondis ».Activez l’option « Activer les arrondis ».Vous aurez la possibilité de multiplier votre petite monnaie par x1, x2, x3 et x5 le montant transféré du reste de vos transactions par carte.Vous pouvez définir vos règles automatiques dans un espace pour transférer automatiquement de l’argent entre vos espaces et votre compte courant. Pour cela :Appuyez sur « Créer une nouvelle règle ».Choisissez les espaces ou le compte courant entre lesquels vous souhaitez effectuer un virement.Saisissez le montant du transfert.Choisissez la fréquence et la date, puis confirmez.Vous pouvez également supprimer cette règle en appuyant sur modifier puis sur l’icône de suppression à côté de la règle.

question: How long does it take to send money with Wise?
answer: Once you've initiated your transfer via Wise you'll be given an estimated time frame. When making a transfer, ensure that the recipients name exactly matches the name on their bank account! If a Wise transfer fails, we’ll notify you via push message. The amount will automatically be returned to your account a few days later.You can't personally cancel a transfer, but if you get in touch with Wise support this way they can cancel the transfer for you. Keep in mind that the transfer can only be cancelled up until the point Wise pays out your funds. Once the money has been sent to the recipient, it's not possible to cancel the transfer anymore.The recipients details can only be changed up until the point that Wise has paid out your money. After your money has been paid out, the recipients details can no longer be changed. You can get in touch with Wise this way.Wise doesn’t charge extra fees for a returned payment and neither do we. However, some participating banks do charge fees, in which case Wise will deduct this amount from the money returned under their Conditions of Use (new tab).Common reasons for a failed transfer:Error in the transfer details (for example, when entering the recipient’s name or account information).Special characters or too many characters in the recipient’s name or reference field.Limits have been reached or online payments aren’t active in card settings.Foreign currency transfers aren’t possible with N26 Business or N26 Business You or if the recipient is a business account.

question: What is a suspicious login attempt?
answer: Why did I receive this email?At N26, security is our top priority. When our system detects an unusual login attempt, we alert you immediately so that steps can be taken to secure your account. If you’ve received an alert and you believe someone else may have attempted to log into your account, a quick reset of your password is all that’s needed. If you recognise the login attempt shown in the alert, you can simply ignore it.How do I reset my password?You can reset your password by logging into your account via your app or web browser, navigating to My Account → Settings → Security. If you cannot access your account, click Forgot Password on the login screen. From there, all you have to do is enter your email address and request a password reset link.When choosing a new password, we remind you not to reuse passwords across multiple platforms; please ensure you utilise a unique password for each of your accounts. Password reuse is a primary reason behind an account compromise.When should I contact Customer Support?After receiving an email about an unusual login, you may be concerned about the security of your account. We would like to reassure you, however, that changing your password is a sufficient measure which will ensure your account remains protected. If you’d like to discuss this topic with someone in the know, our Customer Support team is there for you.

question: How to keep track of my daily spending?
answer:
We automatically sort your transactions and display our findings in Insights (top-right corner of the mobile app) by sorting your:Categories: We collect information on retailers and payment reasons in order to improve our categorization (such as ATM, Food & Groceries, or Shopping). For example, if you send a MoneyBeam with the reference text Lunch, we’ll put it in the Bars & Restaurants category. If you feel like a category doesn’t fit, you can just change it by selecting the transaction and choosing a category from the drop-down list.
Hashtags: We’ve also added default hashtags for transaction times (#weekend), types of transactions (#books), or locations of purchases (#berlin). You can further sort your transactions by adding your own hashtags: tap on a transaction and then the pencil icon to add tags (such as #portugal_trip or #everymonth) or remove unwanted tags.

question: Bank information—your N26 account ownership certificate
answer: What is a bank account ownership certificate?A bank account ownership certificate, also known as a bank account certificate or account confirmation, is a certificate confirming that your bank account is registered in your name, along with relevant bank information. It includes your first and last name, date of birth, the IBAN of your account, and the date you opened it.Your certificate may also include your current account balance and the card numbers of your active cards, if you choose. For security reasons, these will be partially hidden with asterisks.How do I request a bank account ownership certificate?From the web app, click on the download (new tab) icon* and choose Download Bank Information. A PDF will be generated automatically.To request the bank account ownership certificate including your account balance and card number, click on the download (new tab) icon*. Then, under Account Confirmation, select whether you want to include your current balance and/or the card numbers of your active cards and click Request. The PDF will appear in the Messages from N26 (new tab) section of your app within 24 hours.* The download icon is the square with an arrow pointing downward, to the left of the ‘Add Money’ button.

question: What is a security footer, and why have we included one?
answer: A security footer is a personalised message added to the bottom of emails and digital documents, the purpose of which is to act as a seal of authenticity.By adding your full name at the bottom of each email, our aim is to help you to differentiate between legitimate emails sent by N26 and phishing emails sent by fraudsters. Although a security footer cannot definitively prove an email has originated from a verified source, it aids in mitigating the risk of deceptive-phishing - the most common type of phishing attack.What is deceptive-phishing?Deceptive-phishing is the illegal practice of sending generic phishing emails to large quantities of unknown individuals, the objective behind which is to obtain privileged information under false pretences.How is this achieved? Fraudsters contact their targets under the guise of working for well-known companies. Targets are then lured into a false sense of security with brand imagery, time-sensitive scenarios, and misleading language. Once hooked, fraudsters will attempt to manipulate their targets into complying with their demands.How can you protect yourself?Pay close attention to emails you receive from banks, clients, employers, and so on. If you’re asked to do something, never act on impulse; always think carefully before taking action. If you have a feeling that something is off, don’t ignore it. Take notice of incorrect spelling and grammar, hover over (don’t click) hidden URLs, check sender details, and do some research - a quick online check can help you to verify a sender’s identity.If you’ve received a suspicious email, phone call and/or SMS, in the name of N26, forward your concerns to our Customer Support team at support@n26.com. If you’d like to discuss account-related issues, chat to us via our mobile app.Learn more about:How to report suspected phishing attacks (new tab)How to recognize and avoid phishing attacks (new tab)How to protect yourself from social engineering (new tab)

question: Come faccio a fornire la prova dell'origine dei fondi per Il mio conto?
answer: In quanto banca in possesso di piena licenza bancaria, N26 è tenuta a effettuare controlli tecnici di routine sui conti dei clienti. Essendo un'istituzione regolamentata, ciò ci aiuta a garantire che i depositi contenuti nei conti N26 siano al sicuro.A volte, i risultati di questi controlli di routine possono comportare la necessità di contattare il titolare di un conto per chiedere la prova dell'origine dei fondi nel conto in questione, in quanto pratica in linea con la regolamentazione bancaria tedesca.Se ciò dovesse accadere, ti contatteremo sempre e solo all'indirizzo email associato al tuo conto N26. In questa email verranno fornite istruzioni chiare su come poter inviare questi documenti, che possono includere scansioni o foto di ricevute, buste paga, fatture o istruzioni di pagamento.Fai sempre attenzione e verifica che queste email provengano da N26: non chiederemo mai le coordinate bancarie del tuo conto N26, la password o qualsiasi dato condiviso durante il processo di verifica.

question: How to use Moneybeam?
answer: MoneyBeam enables you to send money to your contacts instantly, without having to enter their bank details. You can also request a MoneyBeam from your contacts, in order to receive money. To use MoneyBeam, you and your contacts have to be visible as N26 users.To send a MoneyBeam: Select Send money, then MoneyBeamSelect a contact from your list or add one by entering their phone number and email address.Enter an amount and a reference.Enter your confirmation PIN and confirm the push notification that you will receive.To request a MoneyBeam:Select Add moneyTap Request from friendsSelect a contact from your list or add one by entering their phone number and email address.Enter an amount and a reference.As soon as your contact confirms your request, you will receive the amount you asked for.The limit for MoneyBeams is €1000 per transaction and €5000 every 24 hours.Add a GIF as an additional reference:You can send GIFs as an additional reference text when using MoneyBeam. Once the MoneyBeam is complete, the recipient will be able to see a film emoji as a prefix on the received transfer in the home screen, letting them know the transfer has an attached GIF. The recipient can view the gif within the transfer details along with the reference text.The GIFs are provided to you directly by Giphy, Inc. and not by N26. Be aware that Giphy is a US-based company who may process your personal data in the US. You can find information on how Giphy processes your personal data when you attach and send GIFs in the Giphy Privacy Policy (new tab).   To send a MoneyBeam with a GIF:Select Send money, then MoneyBeam.Select a contact from your list or add one by entering their phone number and email address.Enter an amount and a reference.Select Attach GIF, and either search or scroll for the GIF you want to attachEnter your confirmation PIN and confirm the push notification that you will receive.Would you like to tell your friends about us and earn some money at the same time? Learn more about our friend referral program.

question: PSD2 - Strong Customer Authentication
answer: What is Strong Customer Authentication (SCA)?SCA acts as an additional layer of security for all N26 customers by providing Two-Factor Authentication (2FA). This is an authentication process based on the use of two or more secure elements. You’re probably familiar with using just your personal password to sign in to your account but with Two-Factor Authentication you’ll need either confirmation from a paired device or an SMS code.When you log into your N26 account from the web app or a non-paired device, you’ll be asked to confirm a push notification on your paired device or you can request an SMS code to be sent to your registered number to confirm your login attempt. This ensures that only you can log into your N26 account.When you log into your N26 account from your paired device, Two-Factor Authentication is already in motion. Therefore, the process of logging into your N26 account from your paired device stays the same.Go here for more information on logging in with Two-Factor Authentication Why is Two-Factor Authentication being introduced?SCA is being introduced as part of the revised European Payments Services Directive (PSD2) which applies to all European Banks. The objective of PSD2 is to enhance the security of the customers’ data and account security. Find out more about PSD2 in our dedicated blog post (new tab).

question: How to activate my card?
answer: Activate your N26 Mastercard right from the N26 app and start using it right away! You’ll have to activate your card whether it’s your first N26 card, a replacement card, or you’ve upgraded to an N26 Smart, N26 You, or N26 Metal card.Once you receive your card in the mail, just make sure your smartphone is paired with your account and then:Open your N26 appGo to the Cards tab and swipe until you see the card you’re activatingTap Card Settings and then ActivateEnter the 10-digit number that appears on the front or back of your card and choose your PIN numberTo activate your card on the WebApp (new tab), just select Activate card from the homescreen.FYI, before making an online purchase or a contactless (NFC) payment with your card, you’ll first have to make a chip-and-PIN transaction — in a store or at an ATM.And if multiple cards come in the mail — for example, delivery was delayed and you received more than one card — you can only activate the most recent card. However, if you have a premium account and order a spare card then you’ll still be able to activate that new card.

question: Where is my refund?
answer:
In most cases, your refund will be visible in the app on the day of the original transaction, not the refund date. Scroll down your transaction list or download your previous balance statements to find it.To view and download PDFs of your (preliminary and previous) monthly balance statements:On the WebApp (new tab): From Transactions, click on the cloud icon in the upper-right corner to reach Downloads then select Bank statements.
On the mobile app: If you're using an iPhone, tap on the three dots to the right of your current balance from the main screen. A menu will pop up and will give you the option to access your balance statement. For Androids, you'll find the option under Insights (just tap the 3 dots in the top right-hand corner).The amounts blocked as a car rental deposit can take up to 30 days to return to your account while a refund of a card payment will be automatically credited to your account within a maximum of 14 days.

question: What is a suspicious login attempt?
answer: Why did I receive this email?At N26, security is our top priority. When our system detects an unusual login attempt, we alert you immediately so that steps can be taken to secure your account. If you’ve received an alert and you believe someone else may have attempted to log into your account, a quick reset of your password is all that’s needed. If you recognise the login attempt shown in the alert, you can simply ignore it.How do I reset my password?You can reset your password by logging into your account via your app or web browser, navigating to My Account → Settings → Security. If you cannot access your account, click Forgot Password on the login screen. From there, all you have to do is enter your email address and request a password reset link.When choosing a new password, we remind you not to reuse passwords across multiple platforms; please ensure you utilise a unique password for each of your accounts. Password reuse is a primary reason behind an account compromise.When should I contact Customer Support?After receiving an email about an unusual login, you may be concerned about the security of your account. We would like to reassure you, however, that changing your password is a sufficient measure which will ensure your account remains protected. If you’d like to discuss this topic with someone in the know, our Customer Support team is there for you.

question: Why was I charged an ATM fee?
answer:
The amount of free cash withdrawals you have with your N26 Mastercard depends on your T&C Country (the country you originally shipped your first card to) and which account type (new tab) you have.
 
To avoid certain fees, especially when travelling, you can use the Mastercard ATM Locator (new tab) and select 'no access fee' to find free ATM’s nearby. 
 
If you are charged an ATM fee this could be for a number of reasons and you can find out more below:A €2 fee applies to any additional withdrawal beyond our Fair Use Policy. You can identify this fee in your transaction history as a separate transaction (we’ll remind you via push message when you’re running low on free withdrawals).Some ATM providers may charge independent fees which we can’t reject or reverse. The ATM should display the fee before you complete the withdrawal. In your transaction list the fee is added on top of the withdrawal amount. N26 fees on the other hand appear as separate transactions. Customers in Spain can find a solution here.Foreign currency ATM withdrawals sometimes include fees. With the N26 Standard, N26 Business and Smart account, there’s a fee of 1.7% of the withdrawal amount. This fee is waived for N26 You, Business You or N26 Metal and Business Metal members.Using your Maestro for ATM withdrawals. A €2 fee applies to both domestic or international withdrawals. Maestro is only available in Germany, Austria, or the Netherlands.If you have our N26 Flex account, all withdrawals cost 2€.

question: Chargebacks and card transaction disputes FAQ
answer:
In the event of an unauthorized transaction or even eligible authorized transactions, N26 customers can dispute a payment made with their N26 debit Mastercard and get their money back. Read on for answers to our frequently asked questions on chargebacks, and learn how to dispute a transaction (new tab) in this step-by-step article.I’ve noticed an unauthorized transaction on my account. What should I do?If you’ve noticed an unauthorized transaction on your account, you’ll need to order a new card in order to keep your account secure and prevent further unauthorized transactions from occurring. Go to your N26 app, and re-order your card in the ‘Cards’ tab. You can mark the reason as “lost” or “stolen” based on your situation. If your card was in your possession at all times, you’ll need to re-confirm that you did not make the transaction yourself. Then, if necessary, report the fraud to the police, and follow the instructions to initiate a payment dispute (new tab).  How do I file a dispute for goods I ordered online?The process for filing a dispute for goods ordered online depends on the circumstance. Here’s a breakdown of the most common scenarios:You ordered goods online but never received them, and the merchant provided an expected delivery date
First, you’ll need to wait until the estimated delivery date has passed. If the goods don’t arrive within this timeframe, you can dispute the transaction from the date you expected to receive the goods. Mastercard’s chargeback guidelines state that you must file the dispute within 120 days of the anticipated delivery date.You ordered goods online but never received them, and you were never provided with an expected delivery date 
In this scenario, Mastercard’s chargeback guidelines allow you to file a dispute 30 days after the transaction date, kicking off a 120-day window in which the filing must take place. You received a delivery, but it doesn’t correspond with what you ordered 
Here, you may file the dispute right away, provided you aren't able to resolve the issue with the merchant. You have 120 days from the date you received the goods.I tried to withdraw cash at an ATM. I was charged, but I didn’t receive the cash. What should I do?First, try contacting the bank that owns the ATM. This is the fastest way to get your money back. Here’s some guidance on what to say:Dear XX, I attempted to withdraw cash from an ATM owned by your bank. I did not receive the cash, but was still charged. Below, you can find information about the transaction: Amount: €{insert amount}ATM name: {insert ATM/bank name} ATMDate and time of transaction: DD/MM/YYYY at {insert time} (CET)ATM location: {ATM address - include the name of the street, or shopping mall}Please return the funds to my account, or I will be forced to file a chargeback with my bank. If the bank that owns the ATM is not helpful, follow the instructions to initiate a dispute (new tab). Be sure to include the transaction date, amount, and merchant, as well as your reason for contesting this transaction.I have a previously authorized payment with a merchant who has charged me again without my authorization. What should I do?First, reach out to the merchant to see if they can help––this is the fastest way to get your money back. Here’s a basic template you can use to raise this issue with them: Dear XX, I authorized a transaction to {merchant name}, but {merchant name} has issued an additional charge without my authorization. Please find information about the transactions below: Merchant name: {insert merchant name} Amount of original, authorized transaction: €{insert amount}Amount of non-authorized transaction: €{insert amount}Date & time of original, authorized transaction: DD/MM/YYYY at {insert time} (CET)Date & time of non-authorized transaction: DD/MM/YYYY at {insert time} (CET)Please return the funds to my account, or I will be forced to file a chargeback with my bank and initiate a complaint to the police/authorities.If the merchant is unresponsive or uncooperative, you can follow the instructions here to initiate a chargeback with N26. Be sure to include the transaction date, amount, merchant name, and the reason for contesting the transaction so that we have all the information we need to move your case forward. The merchant told me that they’ve issued a refund to my N26 card, but I never received the refund. What should I do?Refunds can take up to 15 calendar days from the date they were issued by the merchant. If 15 days have passed and you still haven’t received your refund, simply follow the instructions to initiate a dispute (new tab). Please include the transaction date, amount, merchant and your reason for contesting this transaction. How does N26 prevent fraud?At N26, protecting your account is our top priority. That’s why we offer a variety of features to keep your money safe, including the option to block your card in seconds, activate or deactivate payments abroad, enable or disable online transactions, and set spending limits––all right from your N26 app. We also offer biometric authentication for a secure login, 3D Secure technology for safe online payments, and a ‘Discreet Mode (new tab)’ option to securely access your account in public. Instant push-notifications help you stay up-to-date on all your incoming and outgoing payments, so you’re always aware of what’s happening on your account. Plus, we’re always improving our internal processes and tools to detect and prevent card fraud. How does card fraud occur? A: When it comes to debit cards or credit cards, there are 3 main ways in which fraud occurs:Your card is skimmed and counterfeited. This may happen when you use your card at an ATM that’s been tampered with in order to steal card details.Your card details are stolen online. This may happen if: You ordered something from a fraudulent websiteYour details are stolen while making a legitimate purchase Your online shopping account is hacked Your physical card is stolen and used to make purchases.How can I protect my account from fraud? Here are a few ways you can protect your account from fraud:Only use ATMs that belong to trusted banks Only place orders with trusted online retailers and websitesChange your online passwords and PINs regularly Never trust text messages or emails that appear to come from N26 which ask you to provide your card details, account details, or include suspicious links. N26 will never ask for your card or account details outside of the N26 app or the N26 WebApp.Change your card settings within your N26 app. For example, disable online payments, ATM withdrawals, payments abroad, and set spending limits that correspond with your regular spending behavior.Avoid making Magnetic Stripe transactions if possible. Instead, opt for the safer NFC chip-based or digital wallet transactions where available.Always keep your card in a safe place.

question: How to top up by card, Apple Pay, and Google Pay
answer:
You can now add money by using a debit or credit card as well as Apple or Google Pay. This is the fastest and easiest way to fund your N26 account. Adding money with a Debit or Credit cardOpen your N26 app and tap “Add money”Select “Card transfer”Choose an amount and enter your name on card, card number, expiration date and CVC (we never store your card information)Follow the steps to confirm the paymentThe money is available on your account instantly You can choose to deposit between 20€ and 450€ per top-up, for a maximum of 450€ per calendar month.Adding money with a Apple or Google PayOpen your N26 app and tap “Add money”Select “Apple Pay” or “Google Pay”Choose an amount Follow the steps to confirm the paymentThe money is available on your account instantlyAccepted cards: Debit cards.Credit cards (Except America Express).Prepaid cards (only for customers with Italian Terms & Conditions).To find out more about the difference between debit, credit and prepaid cards read this article (new tab).Cost:
Whilst this is the fastest and easiest way to instantly add funds in your N26 account, for us, processing these instant top-up transactions is more expensive than other account funding methods (new tab) we offer.For both methods, the first deposit is always free but extra deposits are charged a fee of 3% of the deposit amount. By charging a card or digital wallet, your money is not sent to N26 instantly, and the fee covers additional costs associated with funding accounts before the money is received so that it is instantly available for your use.

question: Kann ich meine Karte mit Expressversand schneller bekommen?
answer: Die Expresslieferung ist eine gute Wahl, wenn du deine Karte schnell benötigst. Wenn du deine erste Karte bestellst oder eine neue Karte bestellst, steht auch die Option Expressversand zur Verfügung. Die Karte ist nicht nur schneller bei dir, du erhältst auch noch einen Tracking-Link per E-Mail. Wenn du bei der Zustellung nicht zu Hause bist und dein Postfach nicht erreichbar ist, wird die Karte an einen Zugangspunkt in deiner Nähe geliefert (den du über den Tracking-Link findest). Die Karte bleibt nur für eine begrenzte Zeit dort, danach wird sie an uns zurückgesandt. Wir informieren dich in diesem Fall per E-Mail.Wenn du die Expresslieferung wählst, beachte bitte:Deine N26 Standard-, N26 You- oder N26 Metal-Karte wird innerhalb von drei Werktagen ausgeliefert. Die Zustellung erfolgt zwischen 8 und 12 Uhr.Lieferungen können per DHL Express in alle von uns unterstützten Länder innerhalb Europas erfolgen. Lieferungen in andere Länder sind derzeit nicht möglich.Wenn Expresslieferung als Versandart ausgewählt wurde, kann die Lieferung nicht storniert oder geändert werden.Falls du die Expresslieferung gewählt hast und dein Konto nun schließen willst, wird die Gebühr für die Expresslieferung dennoch fällig.Wenn deine Karte nicht innerhalb von 3-5 Werktagen nach deiner Bestellung eingetroffen ist, überprüfe bitte den Tracking-Link auf mögliche Updates. Du kannst den Tracking-Link auch verwenden, um DHL direkt über die Details deiner Lieferadresse zu informieren oder die Sendung umzuleiten, wenn du zum Zeitpunkt der Lieferung nicht zuhause bist.Bei N26 Standard und N26 You kostet eine neue Karte 10€ inklusive Standardversand oder 30€, wenn du dich für eine Expresslieferung entscheidest. Wie viel kostet die Expresslieferung?N26 Standard, N26 Smart & N26 YOU-Karten:Erste Karte bei Kontoeröffnung: 25€Bestellung einer neuen Karte: 30€N26-YOU-Zusatzkarte: 30€N26 Metal-Karten:Erste Karte bei Kontoeröffnung: 25€Bestellung einer neuen Karte: 65€

question: Was ist ein N26 Standard-Konto?
answer: Das N26 Standard-Konto ist ein sicheres und intuitives digitales Girokonto, das du in wenigen Minuten direkt von deinem Smartphone aus eröffnen kannst. Es ist wunderbar einfach und transparent und ermöglicht es dir, Geld problemlos und sicher zu empfangen, zu senden und auszugeben. Das N26 Standard-Konto ist kostenlos* und bietet dir eine einfache und erschwingliche Lösung für alle deine finanziellen Bedürfnisse. Was sind die Vorteile eines ein N26 Standard-Kontos?Unser N26 Standard-Konto bietet die folgenden Vorteile und Funktionen:Kostenloses* Girokonto: Die Nutzung unseres N26 Standard-Kontos ist kostenlos (*ab einem Guthaben von 50.000 € oder höher kann ein Verwahrentgelt (neuen Tab) anfallen).Virtuelle Karte: Das Konto beinhaltet eine kostenlose virtuelle Karte mit einer vollständigen PAN-Nummer und kann zusammen mit Apple Pay oder Google Pay online oder im Geschäft für Einkäufe verwendet werden.Physische N26 Mastercard: Für eine zusätzliche Gebühr von 10 € kannst du eine physische N26 Standard-Debitkarte anfordern (bitte beachte, dass dein Konto nach der Bestellung einmalig mindestens 10 € Guthaben aufweisen muss, um die Produktion und den Versand der Karte auszulösen).Zahlungen und Überweisungen: Du kannst SEPA-Überweisungen mit der mobilen App von N26 senden und empfangen. Außerdem kannst du über Moneybeam sofort Geld an andere N26 Kunden senden.Weitere Finanzprodukte: Wenn sie für dich erhältlich sind, kannst du auch unsere weiteren Finanzprodukte beantragen, z. B. Overdraft, Kredit, N26 Savings usw.CASH26: Abheben und Einzahlen von Bargeld mit CASH26 (AGB für DE, AT und IT).Kundenservice: Du kannst dich mit unserem tollen Kundenservice-Team in Verbindung setzen, indem du die Chat-Funktion in der App nutzt oder einen Chat über unsere Website oder deinem Online-Banking (neuen Tab) startest. Eine Anleitung zur Eröffnung eines N26 Standard-Kontos findest du in diesem Artikel.Unser neues N26 Standard-Konto ist mit einer kostenlosen virtuellen Debitkarte ausgestattet. Mit einem aktiven Standard-Konto kannst du online und im Geschäft bezahlen. Außerdem kannst du deine virtuelle Karte zu deinem Apple oder Google Pay Wallet hinzufügen. Während der Registrierung werden dir 2 Optionen angezeigt:Virtuelle Karte: Du kannst eine virtuelle Karte auswählen, die ohne Mindestguthaben aktiviert werden kann (wenn du dich zu Beginn für eine virtuelle Karte entscheidest, kannst du dir für 10 € später immer noch eine physische N26 Debitkarte zulegen).Physische Karte: Für denselben Preis von 10 € kannst du dich auch von Anfang an für eine physische N26 Debitkarte entscheiden (bitte beachte aber, dass du bei dieser Option auch später keine virtuelle Karte bekommen kannst). Die Details zu deiner virtuellen Karte kannst du in deiner N26 App finden, darunter deine vollständige PAN-Nummer und alles, was du für den Online-Einkauf wissen musst.

question: Was tun bei Verlust oder Missbrauch meiner Karte?
answer: Wenn du deine N26 Karte verloren hast oder du denkst, dass deine Kartendaten missbraucht wurden, kannst du deine Karte jederzeit in deiner N26 App sperren und wieder entsperren.Sperre die Karte vorübergehend oder deaktiviere sie dauerhaft (je nach Fall) und beantrage eine neue in der N26 App oder der Web-App.Falls deine Kartendaten missbraucht wurden, folge diesen Schritten:Gehe auf die Registerkarte Karten.Wische so lange nach rechts, bis die Karte erscheint, die du vorübergehend deaktivieren oder sperren möchtest.Tippe auf Sperren.Falls du deine Karte endgültig sperren willst, wähle schließlich Karteneinstellungen und dann Eine neue Karte beantragen.So hast du die volle Kontrolle über deine Karte und kannst dich vor unberechtigten Transaktionen schützen.Du solltest deine Karte sofort sperren, wenn dir etwas verdächtig vorkommt. Du kannst sie später jederzeit wieder entsperren.

question: What are the benefits of N26 Smart?
answer: A physical N26 Mastercard for free: Choose between five new colors when ordering the card: Rhubarb, Ocean, Sand, Aqua, and Slate.Extra Virtual card: Order an extra virtual card for free in the app!Extra physical card: Order an extra, physical N26 YOU card for a one-off fee of 10€ through your N26 app.Spaces (new tab): 10 additional Spaces (subaccounts) to organise your finances.Shared Spaces (new tab): Invite friends to your Spaces (subaccounts) to share and manage funds together.Dedicated phone support: Contact our dedicated customer support hotline if you have any questions.You can compare N26 Smart with our other plans (new tab) to see which one suits you the best!Keep these (new tab) in mind when considering N26 Smart:The N26 Smart Mastercard has no embossing: the card details, including the number, CVV code, and 10-digit token are printed on the back.If you upgrade to N26 Smart, the monthly fee of €4,90 will be deducted directly from your N26 account every month starting on the date of your upgrade.If you’re a new customer who signed up to N26 Smart, your membership will be active as soon as the first fee is charged. This happens when you topped-up your account to cover the first monthly fee, but at the latest 15 days after you. From then on, you’ll be charged your monthly fee on the same date every month.From now on, you can decide whether to pay your Premium fee monthly or in advance for the next 6 months or 1 year of the contract. If you choose the prepayment option, you will benefit from a discount on the monthly cost of your Premium account (Smart / You / Metal), which will be proportional to the billing period you want to pay. Upon signing up, you will find the prepaid billing options and related costs in your N26 app.Please top up your account right after completing the sign up with at least the amount of the monthly Smart fee in order to receive the card.

question: How to get a bank statement?
answer: A bank statement is a document that shows the total balance of your account and all incoming and outgoing transactions, including transfers, direct debits, card payments, etc. It also shows the name and surname of the account holder, and the IBAN and BIC numbers of the account. Here’s how to find yours:From the mobile app (PDF): on the Home screen, tap the 3 horizontal bars in the top right-hand corner and select Balance Statements.You can also download a statement for a specific space: go to Spaces, choose one of your spaces, tap the settings icon in the top right corner and select Balance Statements.From the web app (PDF): click the download (new tab) icon* and select the relevant month under Bank statements.From the web app (CSV): click the download (new tab) icon* and, under CSV, select the start and end dates you need and click on Download CSV.   * The download icon is the square with an arrow pointing down, placed on the left of the ‘Add money’ button.

question: How long does it take to send money with Wise?
answer: Once you've initiated your transfer via Wise you'll be given an estimated time frame. When making a transfer, ensure that the recipients name exactly matches the name on their bank account! If a Wise transfer fails, we’ll notify you via push message. The amount will automatically be returned to your account a few days later.You can't personally cancel a transfer, but if you get in touch with Wise support this way they can cancel the transfer for you. Keep in mind that the transfer can only be cancelled up until the point Wise pays out your funds. Once the money has been sent to the recipient, it's not possible to cancel the transfer anymore.The recipients details can only be changed up until the point that Wise has paid out your money. After your money has been paid out, the recipients details can no longer be changed. You can get in touch with Wise this way.Wise doesn’t charge extra fees for a returned payment and neither do we. However, some participating banks do charge fees, in which case Wise will deduct this amount from the money returned under their Conditions of Use (new tab).Common reasons for a failed transfer:Error in the transfer details (for example, when entering the recipient’s name or account information).Special characters or too many characters in the recipient’s name or reference field.Limits have been reached or online payments aren’t active in card settings.Foreign currency transfers aren’t possible with N26 Business or N26 Business You or if the recipient is a business account.

question: How to request a refund for a direct debit?
answer: Refunding a direct debit does not cancel the contract you have with the merchant.You have the ability to request a SEPA direct debit refund in the app yourself up to 8 weeks after it has been debited. The direct debit will be credited to your account within 2 banking days.Requesting a direct debit refund in my main account:Login to the N26 mobile appOpen your transaction list and select the direct debit in questionChoose RefundRequesting direct debit refund in my IBAN Space (subaccount):You can also request a direct debit refund in your IBAN-assigned Spaces:Login to the N26 mobile appTap on SpacesGo to the Space you wish to refund a direct debitSelect the direct debit transaction in questionChoose Refund*For Non-Euro countries only: If you are setting up a direct debit with a merchant in your home currency, it's the receiving bank who dictates the currency exchange and the ultimate amount that is collected from us. This applies to the following countries: Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Hungary, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, Poland, Romania, Sweden, Switzerland

question: How to make a SEPA transfer?
answer:
You can send debit transfers to any country within the SEPA zone (if the receiving bank accepts Euros).Outgoing debit transfers can be made in either the N26 app or our Web app.From the Home screen choose the Send money tab,
Select Send Money followed by Bank Transfer and then “add a new recipient”,
Enter the recipient's name and IBAN and select Continue,
Choose the amount and select Next,
Add a message if required or select Skip It,
Check the Transfer Review screen (which sums up the transfer),
Here you can also schedule the date of your transfer and save it as a standing order,
Press send and confirm with your confirmation PIN.You’ll then need to either Confirm or Cancel the transfer via push notification in the app from your paired device.Once the transfer was confirmed in the mobile app, we can't reverse it or change the recipient's details.If you cannot confirm your debit transfer within the app you need to:Ensure that you have a stable internet connection.Ensure that your mobile phone has push notifications enabled. This is done through the phone settings, not in our app.Ensure that you use your paired device.Once your debit transfer is sent you’ll be able to download a PDF confirmation of it. To do so:Go to your Transactions list.
Locate and select the specific debit transfer.
Scroll down to the Transaction Information and tap PDF by selecting Transfer Confirmation.You can also send outgoing SEPA transfers directly from your Spaces with assigned IBANs. Simply go into the Space with an assigned IBAN, select “Send Money” then choose “Bank Transfer”. This will then work like a regular outgoing payment.

question: How can I download the confirmation for a SEPA transfer?
answer: If you have sent a bank transfer from your N26 account and need confirmation of the sending or receipt, you can download the PDF file with the transaction data from your mobile app or WebApp. That's how:Log into your N26 appFrom the list of transactions, select the bank transfer for which you want to download the confirmationClick on "Download transfer confirmation"As soon as you choose this option, the document will automatically be downloaded to your smartphone or pc.What data will I find in the transfer confirmation?In the confirmation of the transfer you will find the bank details of the sender and recipient of the transfer, including the amount of the transaction and the date on which it was made.

question: How to use Bizum with N26?
answer: Bizum is a payment platform integrated into the N26 app that connects your phone number with your bank account. It allows you to send and receive moneyinstantly between customers of different banks, using only the recipient's phone number.With Bizum you can also request money from someone, sending notifications to the sender. Once your request is accepted, you will receive the money immediately.Requirements to use Bizum with your N26 account:Have a Spanish IBAN (new tab) (ES)Have access to the phone number registered in your bank account (new tab). Always remember to keep your phone number up to date.Have your smartphone paired to the N26 app (new tab).How to activate Bizum on N26?Super easy! Go to the Home app screen and click on “Send money”, then click on “Get started”. You will have to confirm your phone number and then you will have completed the registration.What to do if it is not possible to complete the registration in Bizum because the phone number is already in use in another account?This can happen for various reasons, we recommend:Check that your phone number is up to date on N26.Keep in mind that, so far, it is only possible to have Bizum linked only to one bank account. Therefore, if you are already using it on another account, you will have to unlink it from there or follow the Portability steps explained below to use Bizum on N26.If your situation is not one of the two mentioned above, we recommend that you contact our Customer Service from the app for further assistance.Portability: How to bring your Bizum account to N26 from another bank?During the activation of Bizum in N26, after entering your personal data, the app will identify if you are already registered in Bizum with another Bank. In order to activate it on N26, you will have to enter a code that we will send you by text message.How does Bizum work?Go to the Home screen and click on ‘Send money’ or ‘Receive money’, depending on what you want to do; enter your friend’s phone number and the amount. The money you send will arrive instantly, and the requested money will enter your account as soon as the notification is accepted.Limits:How many Bizum transactions can you make?You can receive a maximum of 60 transfers by Bizum per month and make as many shipments as they want.How much money can be sent through Bizum?Bizum's limits are as follows:The amount of each transaction can be from €0.50 to €500.You can send or receive up to a maximum of €2,000 per dayYou can send a maximum of €5,000 and receive a maximum of €60,000 per month.How to deactivate Bizum on N26?You have to go to the “My account” section from the N26 app, then click on “Bizum settings”, and finally on “De-activate”. You will need the confirmation PIN to complete this procedure.What to do if I change my phone number?You will first need to update your phone number (new tab) from the N26 app. Then, if you had already completed the registration in Bizum, then you will have to deactivate it as mentioned above and register again. In this way, the system will update your phone number in Bizum as well.

question: Wie oft kann ich kostenlos Bargeld abheben?
answer: Wie viele kostenlose Bargeldabhebungen du pro Monat mit deiner Mastercard hast, hängt von deiner N26 Mitgliedschaft und von dem Land deiner AGB ab (die Adresse, an die deine Karte ursprünglich geliefert wurde). In deiner mobilen N26 App kannst du zudem jederzeit sehen, wie viele kostenlose Abhebungen pro Monat du noch übrig hast. Logge dich ein und gehe zu: Mein Konto > Nutzung von Geldautomaten.Im Folgenden findest du eine allgemeine Übersicht über kostenlose Abhebungen, geordnet nach dem Land deiner AGB und deiner N26 Mitgliedschaft. Deutschland: N26 Standard & N26 Business: 3 kostenlose Abhebungen am Geldautomaten pro Monat in Euro. Für zusätzliche Abhebungen gilt eine Gebühr von 2€. Außerdem kannst du Geld kostenlos mit CASH26 abheben. Innerhalb der EU (aber außerhalb Deutschlands) hast du unbegrenzt viele kostenlose Abhebungen.  Für Abhebungen in Fremdwährungen gilt eine Gebühr von 1,7%.N26 Smart& N26 Business Smart: 5 kostenlose Abhebungen am Geldautomaten pro Monat in Euro. Für zusätzliche Abhebungen gilt eine Gebühr von 2€. Für Abhebungen in Fremdwährungen gilt eine Gebühr von 1,7%.N26 You & N26 Business You: 5 kostenlose Abhebungen am Geldautomaten pro Monat in Euro. Für zusätzliche Abhebungen gilt eine Gebühr von 2€. Außerdem kannst du Geld kostenlos mit CASH26 abheben. Innerhalb der EU (aber außerhalb Deutschlands) hast du unbegrenzt viele kostenlose Abhebungen. Abhebungen in Fremdwährungen sind kostenlos. N26 Metal & N26 Business Metal: 8 kostenlose Abhebungen am Geldautomaten pro Monat in Euro. Für zusätzliche Abhebungen gilt eine Gebühr von 2€. Außerdem kannst du Geld kostenlos mit CASH26 abheben. Innerhalb der EU (aber außerhalb Deutschlands) hast du unbegrenzt viele kostenlose Abhebungen. Abhebungen in Fremdwährung sind kostenlos.Österreich:Unbegrenzte kostenlose Abhebungen am Geldautomaten sowie CASH26.Italien, Frankreich, Spanien, Niederlande und das übrige Europa:N26 Standard & N26 Business: 3 kostenlose Abhebungen am Geldautomaten pro Monat in Euro. Für zusätzliche Abhebungen gilt eine Gebühr von 2€. Für Abhebungen in Fremdwährungen gilt eine Gebühr von 1,7%.N26 You & N26 Business You: 5 kostenlose Abhebungen am Geldautomaten pro Monat in Euro. Für zusätzliche Abhebungen gilt eine Gebühr von 2€. Abhebungen in Fremdwährungen sind kostenlos. N26 Smart & N26 Business Smart: 5 kostenlose Abhebungen am Geldautomaten pro Monat in Euro. Für zusätzliche Abhebungen gilt eine Gebühr von 2€. Für Abhebungen in Fremdwährungen gilt eine Gebühr von 1,7%.N26 Metal & N26 Business Metal: 8 kostenlose Abhebungen am Geldautomaten pro Monat in Euro. Für zusätzliche Abhebungen gilt eine Gebühr von 2€. Abhebungen in Fremdwährung sind kostenlos.Für die Abhebungen am Geldautomaten mit der Maestro Karte (verfügbar in Deutschland, Österreich und den Niederlanden) gilt immer einer Gebühr von 2€. Wenn du unser N26 Flex Konto hast, gilt für alle Abhebungen eine Gebühr von 2€. Sieh dir unsere Preislisten an, wenn dir eine Geldautomatengebühr berechnet wurde.

question: Why are some products and services unavailable to me?
answer: We collaborate with many partners. That’s why certain products and services require that you meet their requirements as well. The most common reasons why you wouldn’t be eligible for certain products:Expired or unsupported identity documents (for example, certain passports due to a lack of security features).You’re taxable in the United States. If so, you won’t be able to use certain invest or savings products. If this is not the case, contact our Customer Support via chat so we can look into your account details. You may need to switch your telephone number if it starts with a North American area code (+1).The product or service is not yet available in your country.

question: Come si usa Spaces?
answer: Per iniziare a usare i tuoi spazi separati dal conto principale, dovrai entrare nella sezione "Spaces" dell'app mobile N26 o su N26 web. Nella schermata principale di "Spaces" puoi visualizzare, inserire e creare gli Spaces.Creare uno spazio:Vai su "Crea un nuovo spazio" nella schermata principale di "Spaces".Seleziona una delle opzioni sottostanti:"Risparmia per un obiettivo" - Inserisci l'importo dell'obiettivo di risparmio e la data in cui vuoi raggiungerlo (opzionale)."Condividi denaro" - Permette di creare uno "Spazio condiviso"."Crea ora, decidi dopo" - Crea in modo semplice e veloce uno spazio a cui puoi aggiungere obiettivi o regole in un secondo momento.E ora puoi personalizzare il tuo spazio con un nome e un'immagine.Ecco che adesso hai uno spazio separato dal tuo conto principale per controllare meglio le tue finanze! Ora cominciamo a usare "Spaces"!Spostare denaro tra gli spazi:Clicca su "Conto principale" o su un altro spazio separato da esso.Trascina e rilascia la somma di denaro nello spazio desiderato.Ora puoi confermare l'importo e il saldo verrà aggiornato immediatamente.Blocca il tuo spazio:Puoi bloccare e sbloccare uno spazio in qualsiasi momento dalla tua app mobile e web. Non è possibile spostare denaro dentro o fuori uno spazio bloccato.Vai nello spazio che desideri bloccare/sbloccare.Seleziona il pulsante "Gestisci".Clicca su "Blocca spazio" o su "Sblocca spazio".Inserisci il PIN di conferma.Lo spazio verrà bloccato o sbloccato immediatamente.Nascondi il saldo del tuo spazio:Potrai nascondere l'importo dello spazio dal saldo totale del tuo conto.Entra nello spazio di cui vuoi nascondere il saldo.Vai sulla rotella "Impostazioni" (in alto a destra).Seleziona "Nascondi il saldo dello spazio"Gestisci i tuoi spazi separati:Puoi creare regole, obiettivi di risparmio e attivare la funzionalità Spiccioli. All'interno dello spazio vai su "Gestisci":Per creare un obiettivo di risparmio, seleziona "Crea il mio obiettivo" (puoi modificarlo anche in seguito).Basta inserire un importo e una data di scadenza e poi cliccare su "Imposta obiettivo".Per abilitare/disabilitare gli arrotondamenti seleziona "Gestisci Spiccioli".Muovi la levetta "Abilita Spiccioli".Hai la possibilità di moltiplicare il tuo resto per x1, x2, x3 e x5; l'importo corrispondente verrà separato dalle altre transazioni della tua carta.All'interno di uno spazio, puoi impostare delle regole per spostare automaticamente il denaro tra i tuoi spazi e il conto principale:Vai su "Crea una Regola".Scegli gli spazi o il conto principale tra cui desideri trasferire il denaro.Seleziona l'importo che vuoi spostare.Scegli la frequenza e la data, quindi conferma.Puoi anche cancellare questa regola selezionando modifica e poi l'icona di cancellazione accanto alla regola.

question: Come posso far accreditare la pensione sul mio conto N26?
answer:
N26 Bank AG - Conti aperti prima del 26/03/2020 con IBAN tedesco:Far accreditare la tua pensione sul tuo conto N26 è molto semplice. 
Ecco cosa devi fare:Compila online e firma l’apposito modulo fornito da INPS (nuova tabella);Invia il modulo compilato e firmato via email a support@n26.com (ricorda di inviare l’email dall’indirizzo email associato al tuo conto N26).Provvederemo a compilare la parte spettante alla banca e ti spediremo nuovamente il modulo via email entro pochi giorni.
 
Nel modulo potresti trovare riferimenti a Citibank N.A., l’istituto che provvede all'accredito delle pensioni INPS all’estero.N26 Bank AG, Succursale Italiana - Conti aperti dal 26/03/2020 con IBAN italianoAl momento non è possibile accreditare la pensione sul conto N26 per i clienti con IBAN italiano. Sarà nostra premura aggiornare tutti i nostri clienti e fornire tutti i dettagli e le istruzioni in merito non appena il servizio sará disponibile.
 
Nel caso dovessi riscontrare dei ritardi nel pagamento ti chiediamo gentilmente di contattare il nostro Supporto Clienti via chat.

question: Comment utiliser MoneyBeam?
answer: Grâce à MoneyBeam, vous pouvez transférer de l’argent à vos contacts en temps réel sans devoir saisir de coordonnées bancaires. Avec MoneyBeam, vous pouvez également demander de l’argent à vos contacts.
