Bei Zahlungen über 50 € oder kumulativen Zahlungen über 150€ musst du deine Karten-PIN eingeben.Frage den Händler, ob das Zahlungsterminal die kontaktlose Bezahlung auch tatsächlich unterstützt.Bei N26 Metal Karten befindet sich die NFC-Funktion nur auf der Rückseite der Karte. Achte darauf, dass du die Rückseite der Karte an das Terminal hältst, um kontaktlos zu zahlen (mit der Vorderseite funktioniert es nicht).Du musst deine Karte direkt an die NFC-kompatible Oberfläche des Zahlungsterminals halten. Wenn du deine Karte zu schnell weggezogen oder sie nicht nahe genug an die Oberfläche gehalten hast, versuche es einfach noch einmal.Wenn die kontaktlose Bezahlung nicht funktioniert, versuche bitte immer die Zahlung mit Chip & PIN abzuschließen.

question: Was ist ein P-Konto?
answer: Ein Pfändungsschutzkonto (P-Konto) ist ein Girokonto, mit dem du im Falle einer Kontopfändung monatlich über einen pfändungsfreien Betrag verfügst. Der Pfändungsschutz kann auf alle von uns angebotenen Kontotypen angewandt werden – und mit einer deutschen IBAN bist du grundsätzlich dazu berechtigt, dein Konto in ein P-Konto umzuwandeln. Du verfügst dadurch im Falle einer Pfändung über einen monatlichen P-Konto-Freibetrag in Höhe von €1.340, jedoch kann dieser Betrag durch eine aktive Unterhaltspfändung geringer ausfallen. Der P-Konto-Freibetrag steht dir zur Verfügung und wird nicht an den Gläubiger überwiesen. Bitte beachte, dass wir die Umwandlung in ein P-Konto der Schufa Holding AG melden.Wenn wir für dein N26 Konto eine Pfändung erhalten, kannst du dich dazu entscheiden, es in ein P-Konto umzuwandeln. Nach Erhalt einer Pfändung sind wir gesetzlich dazu verpflichtet, dein Konto zu pfänden. Gleichzeitig senden wir dir eine Nachricht mit allen Informationen zur Pfändung an dein sicheres Postfach in deiner N26 App. Bitte lies dir diese Nachricht durch, damit du über alle Optionen informiert bist, bevor du dich für eine entscheidest.Wie du ein P-Konto bekommst, erfährst du hier.

question: Wie schütze ich meine Bankdaten online?
answer:
Ob beim Shopping, Banking oder Verwalten deines Postfachs: Hier findest du einige Tipps, wie du dich und deine Daten im digitalen Raum schützen kannst.Aktualisiere stets deine N26 App und das Betriebssystem deines Smartphones, um immer die aktuellsten Sicherheitsfeatures zu haben.Verwende zum Einloggen den Fingerabdrucksensor oder die Gesichtserkennung.
Nutze starke Passwörter mit Buchstaben, Zahlen sowie Symbolen – und verwende niemals dasselbe Passwort für mehrere Konten.Veröffentliche in den sozialen Medien unter keinen Umständen sensible persönliche Informationen.Sei vorsichtig, wenn du öffentliche oder geteilte WLAN-Verbindungen nutzt – entscheide dich stets für sichere WPA2- anstatt WEP-Netzwerke und verwende wann immer möglich ein VPN.Nutze E-Mail-Provider wie Gmail und Yahoo!, die über Sicherheitsmaßnahmen verfügen, Spamfilter einsetzen und Zwei-Faktor-Authentifizierung anbieten.Nimm dich vor Angeboten in Acht, die zu gut sind, um wahr zu sein – oft handelt es sich um Betrug.Kaufe nur auf vertrauenswürdigen Webseiten bekannter Händler ein.Überprüfe die Sicherheit von Webseiten – halte Ausschau nach dem Schloss neben der URL. Klicke darauf, um dir die Zertifikatsinformationen anzusehen.Aktiviere die Standortverfolgung in deiner N26 App, damit wir verdächtige Transaktionen erkennen können, die möglicherweise nicht du getätigt hast.Falls du denkst, dass sich jemand unbefugten Zugriff auf dein Konto oder deine Kartendaten verschafft hat, ändere bitte umgehend dein Passwort, und erfahre mehr dazu in unserem Artikel: Was tun, wenn meine Kontosicherheit beeinträchtigt wurde?"

question: Où trouver votre numéro d'identification fiscale
answer:
Votre numéro d’identification fiscale (NIF) est unique. Il est délivré par l’administration fiscale lors de votre inscription dans votre pays de résidence fiscale.
 
Votre NIF peut figurer sur différents documents selon votre pays de résidence fiscale. Le NIF de chaque pays peut varier. Par exemple, si vous résidez au Royaume-Uni, vous pouvez considérer votre NIF comme votre Numéro de sécurité sociale (NIN).NIF pour les résidents allemands :Si vous résidez en Allemagne et que vous vous êtes inscrit auprès de l’administration fiscale locale, vous recevrez un NIF ou Steueridentifikationsnummer à 11 chiffres. Ne le confondez pas avec votre numéro fiscal ou Steuernummer à 9 chiffres.
 
Le NIF ne figure pas sur les pièces d’identité, mais vous le trouverez sur les documents suivants :La lettre que vous avez reçue de l’Office central fédéral des impôts délivrant votre NIF ou IdNr (Mitteilungsschreiben über die Zuordnung einer Identifikationsnummer).Avis d’impositionDéclaration d’impôt sur le revenuPour en savoir plus sur la localisation de votre NIF, ou si vous devez en demander un, cliquez ici (nouvel onglet).NIF pour les résidents français :Si vous résidez en France et que vous êtes tenu d’y déclarer vos impôts, l’administration fiscale française vous délivrera un NIF à 13 chiffres ou SPI une fois que vous vous serez inscrit auprès de celle-ci. Ces chiffres commencent par 0, 1, 2 ou 3.
 
Votre NIF figure sur les documents suivants :Déclaration de revenus préimpriméeAvis d’impôtsPour en savoir plus sur la localisation de votre NIF, ou si vous devez en demander un, cliquez ici (nouvel onglet).NIF pour les résidents italiens :Si vous résidez en Italie, le NIF ou Codice fiscale (composé de 16 caractères) n’est valable que si vous êtes inscrit au Registre des impôts italien géré par l’Agence italienne du revenu (Agenzia delle Entrate). Si vous n’avez pas de NIF, vous devez en faire la demande à n’importe quel bureau de l’Agence italienne du revenu.
 
Le NIF ne figure pas sur les pièces d’identité, mais vous le trouverez sur les documents suivants :Carte d’assurance maladie personnelle (numéro d’identification fiscale, Tessera sanitaria/Codice fiscale)Carte d’identification fiscalePour en savoir plus sur la localisation de votre NIF, ou si vous devez en demander un, cliquez ici (nouvel onglet).NIF pour les résidents espagnols :Si vous résidez en Espagne, votre NIF est unique pour des raisons fiscales et douanières. Votre NIF espagnol se compose de neuf caractères (le dernier caractère étant une lettre de contrôle). Les NIF sont délivrés par le ministère de l’Intérieur et peuvent varier selon votre nationalité.
 
Selon votre situation, vous trouverez votre NIF sur les documents suivants :Carte d’identité personnelleCarte d’identité électroniqueCarte de résident pour les étrangersNouveau permis de conduire (depuis 2004)Carte d’identification fiscaleCarte vitalePour en savoir plus sur la localisation de votre NIF, ou si vous devez en demander un, cliquez ici (nouvel onglet).Informations importantes :Le format du NIF autorisé à être saisi dans votre application N26 dépend de votre pays de résidence. Autrement dit, si vous résidez en Allemagne, vous devez saisir votre NIF allemand.Pour vérifier les informations fiscales que vous avez enregistrées sur votre compte, accédez à :Mon Compte > Informations personnelles > Informations fiscales.Si vous avez déjà renseigné votre pays de résidence fiscale mais pas votre identifiant fiscal, il vous suffit de supprimer le pays actuellement renseigné dans l’application et de l’ajouter à nouveau. Vous pourrez alors renseigner votre identifiant fiscal.Pour en savoir plus sur la gestion de vos informations fiscales, cliquez ici (nouvel onglet).

question: What to do if my N26 IBAN is not accepted?
answer: Your IBAN includes the 2 digit country code (e.g. DE), a two-digit check number, the eight-digit bank sort code, and your ten-digit account number. For example: DE XX 10011001 26XXXXXXXX.The participating countries of the SEPA area (Single Euro Payments Area) have agreed on the IBAN system in order to simplify national and international payments, and to reduce the risk of error in the communication and processing of transactions.Merchants or employers who do not accept IBANs from other member states of the European Economic Area are violating European law as of 1 February 2016 (Article 9 of Regulation No 260/2012 (new tab)).If you are ever affected by IBAN discrimination, please contact your relevant national authority (new tab) directly and notify them. Provide your contact details, the name of the merchant or company that didn’t accept your IBAN, as well as a brief description of the incident (including a screenshot of the rejection or other documentation of your communication with them).

question: Domande frequenti sulle contestazioni di pagamento con carta
How to get a bank statement?
answer: A bank statement is a document that shows the total balance of your account and all incoming and outgoing transactions, including transfers, direct debits, card payments, etc. It also shows the name and surname of the account holder, and the IBAN and BIC numbers of the account. Here’s how to find yours:From the mobile app (PDF): on the Home screen, tap the 3 horizontal bars in the top right-hand corner and select Balance Statements.You can also download a statement for a specific space: go to Spaces, choose one of your spaces, tap the settings icon in the top right corner and select Balance Statements.From the web app (PDF): click the download (new tab) icon* and select the relevant month under Bank statements.From the web app (CSV): click the download (new tab) icon* and, under CSV, select the start and end dates you need and click on Download CSV.   * The download icon is the square with an arrow pointing down, placed on the left of the ‘Add money’ button.

question: ¿Qué hace N26 con mi información fiscal?
answer: Este material ha sido preparado con fines exclusivamente informativos y no constituye, ni debe utilizarse como un asesoramiento fiscal, legal o contable.N26 recoge tus datos principalmente por dos motivos: para cumplir con las reglas de «Conozca a su cliente» y por la obligación de comunicar a la agencia tributaria responsable. Obligación de identificar a nuestros clientes siguiendo las denominadas reglas «Conoce a tu cliente»Como otras instituciones financieras, estamos obligados a recabar información fiscal relevante para identificarte a efectos fiscales. Esta información incluye principalmente tu nombre,  dirección de residencia, país o países de domicilio fiscal, número de identificación fiscal o su equivalente, así como el lugar y la fecha de tu nacimiento.A continuación encontrarás información general sobre las definiciones de domicilio fiscal y el número de identificación fiscal.Domicilio fiscalPor lo general, una persona solo tiene un país de residencia (residencia en el país de vivienda o domicilio). Sin embargo, una persona puede residir en dos o más países a efectos fiscales. Esto se debe a que diferentes países aplican distintos criterios (formas de vinculación) para determinar la residencia (o domicilio) a efectos fiscales. Estos criterios pueden incluir, entre otros, la presencia física prolongada, la nacionalidad, la titularidad de la vivienda, etc. Si existe un convenio fiscal entre los países, las reglas en materia de arbitraje que suelen contener dicho convenio asignarán un domicilio fiscal a uno de los países involucrados.Por ejemplo, si tienes un vivienda permanente en el país A y una residencia temporal en el país B, las reglas en materia de resolución de conflictos del convenio para evitar la doble imposición concluido entre el país A y B podrán estipular que eres residente fiscal en el país A en el que tienes una vivienda permanente en lugar de en el país B, en el que tienes una residencia temporal (la «vivienda permanente» se considera como una forma de vinculación más fuerte que la «residencia temporal»). El análisis para determinar el domicilio fiscal se basa en hechos y, si tienes dudas, tendrás que aclararlo con la tu agencia tributaria y/o asesor fiscal.Número de Identificación Fiscal:El Número de Identificación Fiscal (NIF) es una combinación única de letras o números que te ha asignado tu país de domicilio fiscal. El NIF te identifica a efectos de aplicar las leyes fiscales de tu país de domicilio fiscal. Los NIF también son útiles para identificar a los contribuyentes que invierten en otros países. Las especificaciones del NIF (es decir, el número de letras, números y su secuencia) son establecidas por la agencia tributaria de cada país. Aunque la mayoría de países emiten un NIF, hay algunos que no. El portal de intercambio automático de la OCDE (pestaña nueva) proporciona información útil sobre los NIF (especialmente dónde encontrarlos y sus especificaciones) emitidos por muchos países que participan en el intercambio automático de información fiscal. Pero si tienes alguna duda sobre tu NIF, lo más recomendable es que consultes con tu asesor fiscal o con tu agencia tributaria.Obligación de comunicar a las autoridades tributarias competentes  información fiscal relevante de determinados clientesComo otras instituciones financieras, estamos obligados a comunicar periódicamente información fiscal a la agencia tributaria responsable. Dependiendo de tu IBAN, la agencia tributaria receptora puede ser la de Alemania, Italia, España o Francia.Cabe destacar los informes que se llevan a cabo en virtud del Estándar Común de Comunicación (pestaña nueva) (ECR) y la Ley de Cumplimiento Tributario de Cuentas Extranjeras (pestaña nueva) (FATCA). Si eres residente fiscal en un país que aplica el ECR y/o de los EE. UU., la agencia tributaria beneficiaria intercambiará la información recibida de N26 con tu país de domicilio fiscal como parte de los procedimientos de intercambio automático de información en virtud del ECR y la FATCA.Para que N26 cumpla con sus obligaciones de comunicación, especialmente en lo que respecta al ECR y la FATCA, necesitamos recopilar  información fiscal correcta y actualizada (la llamada información de autocertificación). La información de autocertificación incluye nombre, domicilio, país o países de domicilio fiscal, NIF y lugar y fecha de nacimiento. Si eres residente fiscal en EE. UU. (persona estadounidense), también debes proporcionar tu NIF estadounidense (pestaña nueva). A continuación, haz clic en este enlace (pestaña nueva) para leer más sobre la FATCA y qué debes hacer para determinar si eres una persona estadounidense. En el caso que si, debes proporcionarnos tu NIF estadounidense.Estamos obligados a realizar inspecciones periódicas para garantizar que la información fiscal relevante almacenada en nuestro sistema es correcta (la denominada diligencia debida continua). Si la diligencia debida detecta inexactitudes, nos ponemos en contacto contigo para pedirte información exacta y actualizada.Nuestra recomendaciónTe informamos de que estamos obligados a aplicar medidas restrictivas en tu cuenta, como último recurso, si no recibimos información exacta y actualizada para los fines del ECR y de la FATCA descritos anteriormente en los plazos aplicables.Te recomendamos que consultes y actualices tu información fiscal relevante de forma periódica. No olvides que no hacerlo también puede afectarte directamente. Por ejemplo, la agencia tributaria podría imponer sanciones directamente. Para consultar y actualizar tus datos en tu app N26:Ve a Información de la cuenta > Información personal > Información fiscalHaz clic en «Añadir nuevo país fiscal», indica si eres Persona estadounidense y sigue las instrucciones.Para añadir un país fiscal adicional (si eres residente fiscal en más de un país), haz clic en «Añadir nuevo país fiscal» y sigue las instrucciones.Solo puedes eliminar el país fiscal actual tras añadir uno nuevo.Información importantePuedes consultar la información fiscal que tenemos actualmente accediendo a: Información de la cuenta > Información personal > Información fiscalEn todo caso, tus datos personales se almacenarán de forma segura y solo se utilizarán para cumplir los requisitos del ECR, FATCA y similares.No podemos asesorarte sobre tu situación fiscal. Si tienes dudas, te rogamos que consultes con un asesor fiscal o con tu agencia tributaria.

question: Audiences similaires
answer: Traitement des données dans le cadre de Facebook Custom AudiencesLe service Custom Audiences nous permet de créer des audiences personnalisées et similaires. Les audiences personnalisées sont constituées de clients N26 et d’internautes auxquels afficher un contenu personnalisé, ou uniquement d’internautes afin de vous exclure, en tant que client N26 existant, de certaines de nos publicités. Étant donné que vous êtes déjà un client N26, nous ne voulons pas vous afficher des publicités non pertinentes. Les audiences similaires nous permettent de définir un groupe cible pertinent pour lequel les publicités affichées sont plus pertinentes que pour les autres utilisateurs de Facebook. Lesdites « » ressemblent davantage à nos clients qu’à l’utilisateur moyen de Facebook.Afin de profiter des avantages décrits ci-dessus, nous fournissons une version hachée de votre adresse e-mail N26 à Facebook. Ledit « hachage » est une forme de pseudonymisation qui chiffre votre adresse e-mail de manière à ce que vous ne puissiez plus être identifié(e) par cette adresse e-mail hachée. Facebook associe ensuite cette adresse e-mail à votre adresse e-mail Facebook potentielle. Après la mise en correspondance, qu’elle ait réussi ou non, Facebook supprime toutes les adresses e-mail hachées dans les 6 à 8 heures. Facebook ne partage pas ces données avec des tiers ou d’autres annonceurs et n’accorde pas l’accès à ces données. Vous pouvez trouver ces informations et d’autres renseignements dans les conditions de Facebook Custom Audiences (nouvel onglet). Facebook Ireland Limited transfère des données à Facebook Inc., États-Unis. Au sens du Règlement UE 2016/679 (« RGPD »), les États-Unis ne fournissent pas un niveau de protection adéquat des données personnelles ; cela implique, entre autres, que les agences gouvernementales aux États-Unis peuvent avoir le droit d’accéder à vos données sans que des recours effectifs soient disponibles. Vous pouvez révoquer votre consentement conformément à l’art. 6 par. 1. a) du RGPD à ce traitement de données dans l’espace client en ligne et l’application N26 à tout moment. Traitement des données dans le cadre de Google Customer MatchCustomer Match nous permet de créer des audiences personnalisées et similaires. Les audiences personnalisées se composent de clients N26 et d’internautes auxquels afficher un contenu personnalisé, ou uniquement d’internautes afin de vous exclure, en tant que client N26 existant, de certaines de nos publicités sur Google Search Network, l’onglet Shopping, Gmail, YouTube et Google Display Network. Nous ne voulons pas vous montrer des publicités non pertinentes. Les audiences similaires nous permettent de définir un groupe cible pertinent pour lequel les publicités affichées sont plus pertinentes que pour les autres utilisateurs de Google. Lesdites « audiences similaires » ressemblent davantage à nos clients qu’à l’utilisateur moyen de Google.Afin de profiter des avantages décrits ci-dessus, nous fournissons une version hachée de votre adresse e-mail N26 à Google. Ledit « hachage » est une forme de pseudonymisation qui chiffre votre adresse e-mail de manière à ce que vous ne puissiez plus être identifié(e) par cette adresse e-mail hachée. Google associe ensuite cette adresse e-mail à l’adresse e-mail potentielle de votre compte Google. Si cette adresse e-mail ne correspond pas, Google peut toujours l’utiliser dans le cadre d’une vérification de conformité. Toutefois, Google ne l’utilisera pas de toute autre manière pour Customer Match ou tout autre produit Google. Google ne conserve pas les données plus de 48 heures pour créer les audiences Customer Match, et elles sont rapidement supprimées par la suite. Google ne partage pas ces données avec des tiers ou d’autres annonceurs et n’accorde pas l’accès à ces données. Vous pouvez trouver ces informations et d’autres renseignements dans l’article d’assistance Comment Google utilise les données du ciblage par liste de clients (nouvel onglet).Google Ireland Limited transfère des données à Google LLC, États-Unis. Au sens du Règlement UE 2016/679 (« RGPD »), les États-Unis ne fournissent pas un niveau de protection adéquat des données personnelles ; cela implique, entre autres, que les agences gouvernementales aux États-Unis peuvent avoir le droit d’accéder à vos données sans que des recours effectifs soient disponibles. Vous pouvez révoquer votre consentement conformément à l’art. 6 par. 1. a) du RGPD à ce traitement de données dans l’espace client en ligne et l’application N26 à tout moment.

question: Where can I withdraw cash for free?
answer: With your N26 Mastercard you have a certain number of free ATM withdrawals in accordance with our Fair Use Policy. You can also use the Mastercard ATM Locator (new tab) to find ATMs that are free of charge. Withdrawals via CASH26 are always free of charge in participating stores.*For customers in Spain: Some ATM operators in Spain might charge an independent fee of around €2. For the time being, we’re unable to prevent this fee from being charged, but we can help you to get your money back if you contact us via chat directly in the app. In the meantime, here’s a list of all the banks whose ATMs are free to use: AbancaArquiaBanco CaminosBanco PichinchaCaixa OntinyentCaja de IngenierosCajasurCarrefourDeutsche BankEVO BancoIbercajaINGKutxabankOpenbankUnicaja Find here more reasons why you could’ve been charged an ATM fee.

question: Chargebacks and card transaction disputes FAQ
answer:
In the event of an unauthorized transaction or even eligible authorized transactions, N26 customers can dispute a payment made with their N26 debit Mastercard and get their money back. Read on for answers to our frequently asked questions on chargebacks, and learn how to dispute a transaction (new tab) in this step-by-step article.I’ve noticed an unauthorized transaction on my account. What should I do?If you’ve noticed an unauthorized transaction on your account, you’ll need to order a new card in order to keep your account secure and prevent further unauthorized transactions from occurring. Go to your N26 app, and re-order your card in the ‘Cards’ tab. You can mark the reason as “lost” or “stolen” based on your situation. If your card was in your possession at all times, you’ll need to re-confirm that you did not make the transaction yourself. Then, if necessary, report the fraud to the police, and follow the instructions to initiate a payment dispute (new tab).  How do I file a dispute for goods I ordered online?The process for filing a dispute for goods ordered online depends on the circumstance. Here’s a breakdown of the most common scenarios:You ordered goods online but never received them, and the merchant provided an expected delivery date
First, you’ll need to wait until the estimated delivery date has passed. If the goods don’t arrive within this timeframe, you can dispute the transaction from the date you expected to receive the goods. Mastercard’s chargeback guidelines state that you must file the dispute within 120 days of the anticipated delivery date.You ordered goods online but never received them, and you were never provided with an expected delivery date 
In this scenario, Mastercard’s chargeback guidelines allow you to file a dispute 30 days after the transaction date, kicking off a 120-day window in which the filing must take place. You received a delivery, but it doesn’t correspond with what you ordered 
Here, you may file the dispute right away, provided you aren't able to resolve the issue with the merchant. You have 120 days from the date you received the goods.I tried to withdraw cash at an ATM. I was charged, but I didn’t receive the cash. What should I do?First, try contacting the bank that owns the ATM. This is the fastest way to get your money back. Here’s some guidance on what to say:Dear XX, I attempted to withdraw cash from an ATM owned by your bank. I did not receive the cash, but was still charged. Below, you can find information about the transaction: Amount: €{insert amount}ATM name: {insert ATM/bank name} ATMDate and time of transaction: DD/MM/YYYY at {insert time} (CET)ATM location: {ATM address - include the name of the street, or shopping mall}Please return the funds to my account, or I will be forced to file a chargeback with my bank. If the bank that owns the ATM is not helpful, follow the instructions to initiate a dispute (new tab). Be sure to include the transaction date, amount, and merchant, as well as your reason for contesting this transaction.I have a previously authorized payment with a merchant who has charged me again without my authorization. What should I do?First, reach out to the merchant to see if they can help––this is the fastest way to get your money back. Here’s a basic template you can use to raise this issue with them: Dear XX, I authorized a transaction to {merchant name}, but {merchant name} has issued an additional charge without my authorization. Please find information about the transactions below: Merchant name: {insert merchant name} Amount of original, authorized transaction: €{insert amount}Amount of non-authorized transaction: €{insert amount}Date & time of original, authorized transaction: DD/MM/YYYY at {insert time} (CET)Date & time of non-authorized transaction: DD/MM/YYYY at {insert time} (CET)Please return the funds to my account, or I will be forced to file a chargeback with my bank and initiate a complaint to the police/authorities.If the merchant is unresponsive or uncooperative, you can follow the instructions here to initiate a chargeback with N26. Be sure to include the transaction date, amount, merchant name, and the reason for contesting the transaction so that we have all the information we need to move your case forward. The merchant told me that they’ve issued a refund to my N26 card, but I never received the refund. What should I do?Refunds can take up to 15 calendar days from the date they were issued by the merchant. If 15 days have passed and you still haven’t received your refund, simply follow the instructions to initiate a dispute (new tab). Please include the transaction date, amount, merchant and your reason for contesting this transaction. How does N26 prevent fraud?At N26, protecting your account is our top priority. That’s why we offer a variety of features to keep your money safe, including the option to block your card in seconds, activate or deactivate payments abroad, enable or disable online transactions, and set spending limits––all right from your N26 app. We also offer biometric authentication for a secure login, 3D Secure technology for safe online payments, and a ‘Discreet Mode (new tab)’ option to securely access your account in public. Instant push-notifications help you stay up-to-date on all your incoming and outgoing payments, so you’re always aware of what’s happening on your account. Plus, we’re always improving our internal processes and tools to detect and prevent card fraud. How does card fraud occur? A: When it comes to debit cards or credit cards, there are 3 main ways in which fraud occurs:Your card is skimmed and counterfeited. This may happen when you use your card at an ATM that’s been tampered with in order to steal card details.Your card details are stolen online. This may happen if: You ordered something from a fraudulent websiteYour details are stolen while making a legitimate purchase Your online shopping account is hacked Your physical card is stolen and used to make purchases.How can I protect my account from fraud? Here are a few ways you can protect your account from fraud:Only use ATMs that belong to trusted banks Only place orders with trusted online retailers and websitesChange your online passwords and PINs regularly Never trust text messages or emails that appear to come from N26 which ask you to provide your card details, account details, or include suspicious links. N26 will never ask for your card or account details outside of the N26 app or the N26 WebApp.Change your card settings within your N26 app. For example, disable online payments, ATM withdrawals, payments abroad, and set spending limits that correspond with your regular spending behavior.Avoid making Magnetic Stripe transactions if possible. Instead, opt for the safer NFC chip-based or digital wallet transactions where available.Always keep your card in a safe place.

question: Where does N26 invest my money?
answer: We strive to provide our clients' deposits for loans to our customers (provided that they have the appropriate credit rating). For the liquidity not required in the customer business, our investment strategy is low in risk.We invest our customers' money at short notice with the Deutsche Bundesbank and other European banks in the eurozone with only good risk classes. And we refinance public-law customers mainly in Germany (cities and municipalities) and invest in euro government bonds.We're not a trading book institute. That is: we do not trade for short-term profit.And we don't engage in speculation, whether on food, foreign exchange, bitcoins or other asset classes.

question: How to top up my account?
answer: Once you are successfully verified, you'll be able to top up your account in several ways. To do so, simply go to the N26 app and select 'Add Money' to see the available options:1. SEPA Transfer (Up to 2 business days):The transfer must be in EUR and within the SEPA zone.You will need to provide your IBAN and your name as it is written on the ID you used to create your account.If you have a Business account, please keep in mind that we do not accept company names.Since 1st July 2020 a limit of 100.000€ for incoming SEPA instant transfers applies.No limit applies to normal incoming SEPA transfers2. Debit or Credit Card (instant):You can choose to deposit between 20€ and 450€ per calendar month.The first deposit is free. The following deposits charge a fee of 3 % of the deposit amount.Simply enter the card details from the sending account.Please note, prepaid cards and American Express credit cards are not accepted.3. Apple Pay or Google Pay (instant):You can choose to deposit between 20€ and 450€ per calendar month.The first deposit is free. The following deposits charge a fee of 3 % of the deposit amount.Simply enter the card details (credit or debit) linked to the Apple Pay or Google Pay account.Please note, prepaid cards and American Express credit cards are not accepted.4. Moneybeam (instant):You can receive money from other N26 users.5. CASH26 (instant):Available in Germany, Austria, Italy, Spain and Greece.Deposit cash through our partner stores once your card is activated and with your paired device.6. iDEAL (instant):Available only in the Netherlands for customer with Dutch T&C and with a iDEAL accountThe first deposit is free. The following deposits charge a fee of 1.5 % of the deposit amount.7. GiroPay (instant):Only available in Germany for customers with German Terms and Conditions and a Giropay account.8. EPS (instant):Only available in Austria for customers with Austrian Terms and Conditions and an EPS account.9. Bancontact (instant):Only available in Belgium for customers with Belgian Terms and Conditions and a Bancontact account.Important reminder for SEPA Transfers:If you deposit money into your N26 account via SEPA transfer, please make sure that the recipient name corresponds to your name as it is entered on the identification document that you used for your verification when opening the account.(Especially if you have an N26 Business account - we do not accept company names.) An incoming transfer is booked in real time, as if it was made as a real time transfer, otherwise a transfer takes 1-2 working days. From July 1st, 2020, there will be a limit of € 100,000 for incoming real-time transfers. In France, the first payment must be made to your N26 account from an account that you own. (In all other countries it is not necessary that the other bank account belongs to you.)

question: My card is expiring soon, what do I have to do?
answer: If your N26 Mastercard has expired or will expire soon, in this article you will find all the information on how to order a new one, the related costs and shipping times. Before proceeding with reordering a new card, we recommend that you check that all your personal details are correct and up to date and.If your card is expiring soon, please log into your N26 account in the app, go to Cards Tab and look for a banner under the corresponding card. Follow the steps to confirm where you’d like to receive your replacement card and we’ll send it to you. If you don’t see that message, don’t worry. This is probably because your card still has some validity time ahead, when the time is right you’ll have the option to confirm your address.Once your card arrives, you will have to activate it before you can begin using it. Don’t forget to destroy your old card and dispose of it according to your local recycling guidelines.Can I keep using my card after it has expired?How much does it cost to get a replacement for my expiring or expired card?My card already expired but I never received a replacement

question: Upfront Payments for Premium membership plans
answer: Your membership contract is valid for one year, after which it automatically renews for an indefinite period until you cancel it—this can be done at any time (see below). We’ll notify you 2 months before your contract is due to be renewed indefinitely.Which billing options are available to me?You can choose to pay for your annual membership fee on a monthly basis, or pre-pay multiple months (e.g. 6 or 12 months) to receive a discount. This doesn’t affect the length of your annual contract.For example, if you choose to prepay 6 months at a time, you’ll make one payment for the first 6 months of your yearly contract when your membership begins, and a second payment in 6 month’s time for the second half of your yearly contract.How and when can I pay?Your membership will become active and you’ll receive full access to your premium benefits only after you pay the first membership fee. You can choose to pay your first fee by using a debit or credit card, Apple Pay or Google Wallet, which will give you instant access to your premium features right after you’ve verified your identity. Alternatively, you can choose to top up your account balance, and we'll automatically deduct the first membership fee from your account.If we haven’t received your payment for the first membership fee (i.e., your first monthly fee or your first prepayment) within the first 15 days after you’ve proved your identity, we’ll deduct this fee automatically from your N26 account at that time and grant you access to your premium benefits. After this, your membership fee will be automatically deducted from your N26 account according to the billing option you’ve selected.How can I cancel my N26 membership?You can stop the automatic renewal of your membership at any time before the end of the first 12-month contract by contacting us via support chat. If you choose to stop your renewal, you can continue to use your N26 Mastercard and all your premium membership benefits until your membership expires. That means you’ll keep your insurance coverage (for N26 You and N26 Metal) for as long as you’re still required to pay your membership fee. You can immediately cancel your membership at any time by contacting us. If you choose this option, your N26 Smart, N26 You and N26 Metal premium N26 Mastercard will be deactivated and we will issue you a virtual card upon downgrading to N26 Standard. If you choose this option with N26 You or N26 Metal, your insurance coverage will also cease immediately.Revoke: You can revoke your membership within the 14-day period, which starts as soon as the first fee is charged. We will deactivate your premium N26 Mastercard and issue you a virtual card for use with an N26 Standard account.Can I get a refund?If you cancel your membership within the 14-days revocation period using our support chat, we’ll fully refund your initial fee. If you cancel a prepaid membership after the 14-days revocation period, you’ll receive a refund for any remaining months that have been prepaid.However, if you originally prepaid at a discounted price, you’ll receive a refund for any remaining months as if you were subject to the full payment price. You will only get the discount if you stay subscribed through the full period of your prepayment

question: Kann ich ein Konto eröffnen, wenn ich außerhalb der Eurozone wohne?
answer: Wenn du in Polen, Schweden, Dänemark, Norwegen, Liechtenstein, Island oder der Schweiz lebst, kannst du ein N26 Konto eröffnen. Wir bieten dir:Die Wahl zwischen einem Standard-Konto oder N26 Business.Ein Konto in Euro, eine deutsche IBAN und Überweisungen per SEPA oder MoneyBeam.Einen günstigen Wechselkurs mit deiner Mastercard Debitkarte.Kostenloser Versand deiner Mastercard oder Expressversand für 25€.Überweisungen in Fremdwährungen mit Wise (neuen Tab) (mit dem Standard-Konto).3-5 gebührenfreie Abhebungen am Geldautomaten (1.7% Gebühr auf Abhebungen in Fremdwährungen).0.1% Cashback auf alle Kartenzahlungen ( bei N26 Business).2 zusätzliche Spaces zu deinem HauptkontoEinen Bonus für alle Freunde, die du über unser Freundschaftswerbungsprogramm erfolgreich zu N26 einlädst.Kontaktlose Zahlungen mit Google Pay und Apple Pay.Tipps für ein- und ausgehende Zahlungen:Damit du stets den günstigsten Wechselkurs erhältst, empfehlen wir dir, bei Einkäufen und Bargeldabhebungen mit deiner Mastercard stets deine Landeswährung auszuwählen (andernfalls können zusätzliche Gebühren anfallen).Um Geld in deiner Landeswährung auf dein Euro-Konto einzuzahlen, empfehlen wir dir eine SEPA-Überweisung über die Wise-Website (neuen Tab), unser Partner für Geldtransfers in Fremdwährungen. Alternativ kannst du auch über deine örtliche Bank Geld überweisen.Ausgehende Überweisungen auf Euro-Konten kannst du ganz einfach über die Standardfunktion in der N26 App tätigen. Überweisungen auf Konten in Fremdwährungen kannst du über Wise auch in der App tätigen.**Bitte beachte: Wise ist nicht für N26 Business verfügbar (nur SEPA-Überweisungen in Euro).

question: ¿Qué es CASH26?
answer: Disponible para las cuentas abiertas en España, Alemania, Austria, Italia y Grecia.CASH26 es una funcionalidad integrada en la app N26 que te permite ingresar dinero en efectivo en tu cuenta N26 y sacar dinero con el móvil, sin tarjeta y sin cajero automático.Solo tienes que dirigirte a uno de los más de 1255 establecimientos CASH26 repartidos por toda España (BonPreu, Condis, Grupo MAS, Gadisa), generar un código de barras CASH26 y enseñárselo en la pantalla de tu móvil vinculado a la persona que haya en el mostrador, diciendo que quieres depositar o retirar dinero con nuestro socio Viacash. Ingresar dinero en efectivoEl código de barras dura solo 10 minutos; si no lo usas a tiempo, caducará y tendrás que generar uno nuevo.Cuando deposites el dinero, podrás disponer de él inmediatamente, aunque puede tardar hasta 10 minutos en verse reflejado en el saldo de tu cuenta en la app N26.¿Qué cantidad se puede ingresar en efectivo con CASH26?El mínimo es de 50 € por depósito y el máximo es de 999 € cada 24 horas.Sea cual sea la cantidad, se cobra una comisión del 1,5 % sobre el importe total.También hay un límite combinado de retiradas e ingresos de 999 € cada 24 horas.Sacar dinero con el móvilEn cuanto generas el código de barras CASH26, la cantidad seleccionada se deduce del saldo de tu cuenta inmediatamente. Si cambias de opinión y borras el código antes de usarlo, o si dejas que caduque a los 10 minutos, el dinero volverá inmediatamente al saldo de tu cuenta.¿Cuánto dinero se puede retirar en efectivo con CASH26?El máximo es de 200 € por cada retirada y de 900 € cada 24 horas. No hay ningún mínimo de retirada, como si quieres sacar un céntimo.También hay un límite combinado de retiradas e ingresos de 999 € cada 24 horas.Las retiradas con CASH26 no tienen comisión, son gratis.Lee este otro artículo para aprender cómo retirar e ingresar dinero en efectivo con CASH26.

question: How to make N26 my main account?
answer: We can help make N26 your main account by moving your daily banking from another account: we’ll inform any payment partners who charge recurring direct debits (like for your monthly subscriptions or bills) or who transfer money to your account (such as your employer), and we’ll explain how to set up standing orders or transfer any remaining funds over.There are three ways to switch your bank accounts over to N26:Account switching service powered by finleap connect GmbHTogether with our partner finleap connect GmbH (new tab) we’re offering you a platform to easily switch your bank accounts online. It’s an automated process and completely free.Log into your N26 mobile app and tap on My account > Switch to N26. Tap Start now and follow the instructions.Alternatively, you can use this form (new tab) and log in with your previous bank account details. Once you’ve filled in all required information, it’ll take 5 to 7 business days for us to send out all notification letters. Your payment partners may need additional time to change your bank details for future transactions.Account switching service supportYou could also inform your payment partners yourself. To do this, fill out the letter to notify your payment partners (new tab) and send it to them. You could also request the termination of your bank account (new tab) with your previous bank by filling out the form and sending it to them.This service is also free. If you need help with this process, contact our Customer Support via chat.

question: How to prove my identity?
answer: As a licensed bank, it’s important that we know who our customers are. That’s why we request our customers to prove their identity with a supported ID document when they open an account or use certain products.We would never ask you to prove your identity on behalf of other individuals or companies. We’ve gathered other tips to help you protect your identity.There are two different ways you can show us your ID, and we've also collected some troubleshooting tips for each: photo and video. The method you can choose to show us your ID depends on your nationality, your country of residence, and the type of ID you use:I live in Germany (new tab)I live in Spain (new tab)I live in Italy (new tab)I live in a different country (new tab)As a fully-licensed and regulated bank, N26 must adhere to strict industry standards and guidelines when it comes to the verification of all potential customers. These vary by nationality, which is why we are only able to conduct the important step of identity verification with specific types of identity documentation for specific nationalities. If your identity documents are not currently supported, it means we won’t be able to offer you an account with us at this time. That said, we're always adding new documents to this list, so it's worth checking back to see if yours has been added.In case your residential address is in Germany and you're unable to complete your photo or video verification due to a disability, please start the registration process by entering your details and then contact our Customer Support. We're happy to assist you.Chat is available everyday from 07:00-23:00 including Sundays and bank holidays.

question: Why didn't I receive my pairing code via SMS?
answer: For iOS customers who are not receiving our Pairing SMS, you may have a feature enabled that filters our SMS. To find our message in iMessage, go to the Filters option in the top left and select the Unknown senders folder.A pairing code is required to connect your smartphone to your account. If you didn’t receive this code via SMS for whatever reason, you can request a new one up to five times in the mobile app. Please wait 30 seconds before requesting a new one. If all five codes are requested and pairing is still unsuccessful, then for security reasons you’ll be blocked from making further requests for 24 hours. If this happens, you can either wait or contact our Customer Support via chat - who would be happy to help you.If your country code is outside of the EU, it’s likely that you’ll need to contact us to receive a pairing code.

question: Do I have to declare my N26 account in Spain?
answer: The Agencia Tributaria offers assistance to those who need to declare their taxes and assets in a foreign country.   In regards to your N26 account, this will depend on the type of IBAN you have: If you have a Spanish IBAN (starting with ES), your account is Spanish and you don’t need to declare it. If you have a German IBAN (starting with DE), your account and money is situated in Germany. In this case you would be obligated to declare it, following specific legal requirements. To know if one of the above scenarios applies to your N26 account, I’d recommend that you inquire with a professional in regards to this matter as we’re not eligible to give tax advice.  Read more information about this in the official website of the Agencia Tributaria (new tab).

question: Why was I charged more than expected?
answer: All transactions take place in real-time. We'll alert you when any incoming or outgoing transaction happens via push message.Sometimes a transaction could look suspicious because the final debited amount can differ from the original transaction amount for a few reasons:A merchant blocks a higher amount for a deposit (for example, at a gas station, or a car rental or hotel booking), and the difference is credited to your account once the deposit is no longer required.Changes in exchange rates may result in slight differences in the total for transactions made in foreign currencies.In both cases, we don’t charge interest for the difference in amounts.But if you’re certain that a transaction is unauthorized by you, we could help get your money back.

question: How to get push messages?
answer: We send you push messages to finalize transfers (such as MoneyBeam) or to confirm a service (as with CASH26- please note this is only available in Germany, Austria, Italy). If you aren’t receiving these messages, first check that notifications are enabled for both your phone and the app. Then try some of our troubleshooting suggestions, depending on your smartphone:iOS:Delete the app and restart your smartphone. Download and install the latest version of the app from the Apple App Store and connect your smartphone again.Check whether you’re logged into your N26 app.Make sure messaging for the app has been activated in the general settings of your smartphone.Android:Delete the app and restart your smartphone. Download and install the latest version of the app from the Google Play Store and connect your smartphone again.Go to your Account settings and activate notification by tapping App settings then Notifications.Huawei and Xiaomi: go to Settings then Advanced settings and Battery settings. Then set N26 as a protected app.OnePlus: select battery optimization then the N26 app and then don't optimize.Oppo: disable battery optimization for the app and lock it in the Recent apps overview.

question: How to keep track of my daily spending?
answer:
We automatically sort your transactions and display our findings in Insights (top-right corner of the mobile app) by sorting your:Categories: We collect information on retailers and payment reasons in order to improve our categorization (such as ATM, Food & Groceries, or Shopping). For example, if you send a MoneyBeam with the reference text Lunch, we’ll put it in the Bars & Restaurants category. If you feel like a category doesn’t fit, you can just change it by selecting the transaction and choosing a category from the drop-down list.
Hashtags: We’ve also added default hashtags for transaction times (#weekend), types of transactions (#books), or locations of purchases (#berlin). You can further sort your transactions by adding your own hashtags: tap on a transaction and then the pencil icon to add tags (such as #portugal_trip or #everymonth) or remove unwanted tags.

question: How to use Moneybeam?
answer: MoneyBeam enables you to send money to your contacts instantly, without having to enter their bank details. You can also request a MoneyBeam from your contacts, in order to receive money. To use MoneyBeam, you and your contacts have to be visible as N26 users.To send a MoneyBeam: Select Send money, then MoneyBeamSelect a contact from your list or add one by entering their phone number and email address.Enter an amount and a reference.Enter your confirmation PIN and confirm the push notification that you will receive.To request a MoneyBeam:Select Add moneyTap Request from friendsSelect a contact from your list or add one by entering their phone number and email address.Enter an amount and a reference.As soon as your contact confirms your request, you will receive the amount you asked for.The limit for MoneyBeams is €1000 per transaction and €5000 every 24 hours.Add a GIF as an additional reference:You can send GIFs as an additional reference text when using MoneyBeam. Once the MoneyBeam is complete, the recipient will be able to see a film emoji as a prefix on the received transfer in the home screen, letting them know the transfer has an attached GIF. The recipient can view the gif within the transfer details along with the reference text.The GIFs are provided to you directly by Giphy, Inc. and not by N26. Be aware that Giphy is a US-based company who may process your personal data in the US. You can find information on how Giphy processes your personal data when you attach and send GIFs in the Giphy Privacy Policy (new tab).   To send a MoneyBeam with a GIF:Select Send money, then MoneyBeam.Select a contact from your list or add one by entering their phone number and email address.Enter an amount and a reference.Select Attach GIF, and either search or scroll for the GIF you want to attachEnter your confirmation PIN and confirm the push notification that you will receive.Would you like to tell your friends about us and earn some money at the same time? Learn more about our friend referral program.

question: Wie verwendet N26 meine Steuerinformationen?
answer: Die folgenden Angaben wurden nur zu Informationszwecken erstellt und dienen nicht der steuerlichen, rechtlichen oder buchhalterischen Beratung und sollten auch nicht als solche verstanden werden.N26 sammelt deine Daten hauptsächlich aus zwei Gründen: um die "Know Your Customer"-Anforderungen zu erfüllen und um die Meldepflicht gegenüber den zuständigen Steuerbehörden zu erfüllen. Verpflichtung zur Identifizierung unserer Kunden nach den sogenannten "Know your customer"-RegelnWie jedes Finanzinstitut sind wir nach den geltenden Steuergesetzen verpflichtet, steuerlich relevante Informationen von dir zu sammeln, um dich für steuerliche Zwecke zu identifizieren. Dazu gehören vor allem dein Name, deine Wohnsitzadresse, das Land oder die Länder, in denen du steuerlich ansässig bist (Steuerwohnsitz / Steuerwohnsitze), deine Steueridentifikationsnummer oder deren Äquivalent sowie dein Geburtsort und -datum.Im Folgenden sind allgemeine Informationen zu den Definitionen von Steuerwohnsitz und Steueridentifikationsnummer aufgeführt.SteuerwohnsitzIn der Regel hat man einen Wohnsitz, in dem Land , in dem man wohnt (Wohnsitzadresse). Man kann jedoch in zwei oder mehr Ländern steuerlich ansässig sein (Steuerwohnsitz haben). Das liegt daran, dass die Länder zur Bestimmung des steuerlichen Wohnsitzes unterschiedliche Kriterien (Formen der Bindung) verwenden. Zu diesen Kriterien gehören u. a. eine längere physische Anwesenheit, die Staatsangehörigkeit, der Besitz von Eigentum usw. Wenn es ein Steuerabkommen zwischen den Ländern gibt, wird der steuerliche Wohnsitz aufgrund der in einem solchen Abkommen normalerweise enthaltenen Kollisionsnormeneinem der beteiligten Länder zugewiesen.Wenn du beispielsweise eine ständige Wohnstätte in Land A und einen vorübergehenden Wohnsitz in Land B hast, kann es sein, dass die Regeln des Steuerabkommens zwischen Land A und B vorsehen, dass du in Land A steuerlich ansässig bist, wo du eine ständige Wohnstätte hast, und nicht in Land B, wo du einen vorübergehenden Wohnsitz hast (wobei "ständige Wohnstätte" eine stärkere Form der Bindung darstellt als "vorübergehender Wohnsitz"). Wenn du dir unsicher bist, wo du steueransässig bist, musst du das mit deiner Steuerverwaltung und/oder deinem Steuerberater klären.SteueridentifikationsnummerDie Steueridentifikationsnummer (Steuer-IdNr.) ist eine eindeutige Kombination aus Buchstaben oder Zahlen, die dir von dem Land, in dem du steuerlich ansässig bist, zugewiesen wird. Die Steuer-IdNr. identifiziert dich für Zwecke der Steuerverwaltung in dem Land, in dem du steuerlich ansässig bist. Die Steuer-IdNr. ist auch nützlich, um Steuerpflichtige zu identifizieren, die in anderen Ländern investieren. Die Spezifikationen für die Steuer-IdNr. (d. h. die Anzahl der Buchstaben, Zahlen und ihre Reihenfolge) werden von den Steuerverwaltungen der einzelnen Länder festgelegt. Während die meisten Länder Steuer-IdNr. vergeben, gibt es einige, die keine Steuer-IdNr. vergeben. Auf dem Portal für den automatischen Informationsaustausch der OECD (neuen Tab) findest du nützliche Informationen zu den Steuer-IdNrn. (vor allem, wo du sie findest und und ihre Spezifikationen). Bei Zweifeln über deine Steuer-IdNr. empfehlen wir dir jedoch, deinen Steuerberater oder deine Steuerverwaltung zu konsultieren.Verpflichtung zur Meldung steuerlich relevanter Informationen bestimmter Kunden an die zuständigen SteuerbehördenWie jedes Finanzinstitut sind auch wir verpflichtet, steuerlich relevante Informationen regelmäßig an die zuständige Steuerbehörde zu melden. Abhängig von deiner IBAN kann die empfangende Steuerbehörde in Deutschland, Italien, Spanien oder Frankreich liegen.Besonders erwähnenswert sind die Berichte nach dem Common Reporting Standard (neuen Tab) (CRS) und dem Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (neuen Tab) (FATCA). Falls du steuerlich in einem Land ansässig bist, das CRS anwendet und/oder wenn du in den USA steuerlich ansässig bist, tauscht die empfangende Steuerbehörde die von N26 erhaltenen Informationen im Rahmen des automatischen Informationsaustauschs gemäß CRS und FATCA mit dem Land aus, in dem du steuerlich ansässig bist.Damit N26 seinen Meldepflichten, insbesondere in Bezug auf CRS und FATCA, nachkommen kann, müssen wir genaue und aktuelle steuerrelevante Informationen von dir sammeln (sogenannte Selbstauskunftsdaten). Zu diesen Daten gehören Name, Wohnsitzadresse, das Land oder die Länder, in denen du steuerlich ansässig bist, Steuer-IdNr. sowie Geburtsort und -datum. Wenn du in den USA steuerlich ansässig bist (Person der Vereinigten Staaten), solltest du auch deine US-Steuer-IdNr (neuen Tab). angeben. Bitte folge diesem Link (neuen Tab), um mehr über FATCA zu erfahren und was du gegebenenfalls unternehmen musst, um herauszufinden, ob du eine Person der Vereinigten Staaten bist und uns daher deine US-Steuer-IdNr. mitteilen solltest.Wir sind verpflichtet, regelmäßig zu überprüfen, ob deine in unserem System gespeicherten steuerlich relevanten Informationen korrekt sind (sogenannte laufende Due Diligence). Sollten sich im Rahmen der Due Diligence Ungenauigkeiten ergeben, setzen wir uns mit dir in Verbindung, um genaue und aktuelle Informationen zu erhalten.Unsere EmpfehlungBeachte bitte, dass wir als allerletztes Mittel restriktive Maßnahmen für dein Konto ergreifen müssen, sollten wir nicht in der Lage sein, genaue und aktuelle Informationen für die oben beschriebenen Zwecke für CRS und FATCA innerhalb der geltenden Fristen zu erhalten.Wir raten dir, deine steuerlich relevanten Informationen regelmäßig zu überprüfen und zu aktualisieren. Bitte bedenke, dass eine Nichtbeachtung auch unmittelbare Folgen für dich haben kann, wie z. B. die Verhängung von Bußgeldern durch die Steuerbehörde. Um deine Informationen zu überprüfen und zu aktualisieren, schaue in deine N26 App:Gehe zu Kontodetails > Persönliche Details > SteuerinformationenWähle Neues Steuerland hinzufügen. Gib an, ob du eine Person der Vereinigten Staaten bist und folge den AnweisungenUm ein weiteres Steuerland hinzuzufügen (wenn du in mehr als einem Land steuerlich ansässig bist), klicke auf "Neues Steuerland hinzufügen" und folge den AnweisungenDas bestehende Steuerland kann erst entfernt werden, nachdem du ein neues Steuerland hinzugefügt hastWichtige InformationenDu kannst die Steuerinformationen, die wir aktuell von dir erfasst haben, jederzeit überprüfen. Dafür gehst du auf: Kontodetails > Persönliche Einstellungen > Steuerinformationen.Deine personenbezogenen Daten werden in jedem Fall sicher gespeichert und nur zur Erfüllung von CRS, FATCA und ähnlichen Anforderungen verwendet.Wir können dir keine Auskunft über deinen Steuerstatus geben. Wenn du dir nicht sicher bist, bespreche die Angelegenheit mit einem Steuerberater und/oder der Steuerbehörde.

question: Why was I charged a direct debit fee?
answer: Direct debits returned to your account due to insufficient funds* are charged a €3 fee (the fee for customers with a Spanish IBAN is €9) in accordance with our Terms & Conditions (new tab). If your balance becomes negative due to this fee, overdraft interest will also apply at a rate of 8.9%.You can avoid these fees by making sure you have enough funds in your account to cover incoming direct debits by 18:00 on the same business day.We suggest you use SEPA Instant credit transfers, MoneyBeam (between N26 accounts), CASH26 (if you live in Germany, Austria, Spain, Greece or Italy) or the Debit/Credit card option (new tab) to transfer the amount due. With these methods, the amount will be credited to your account instantly.If you don’t recognize a direct debit, you can request a refund in the app.IBANs for Spaces: If you have assigned an IBAN to a Space and you do not have enough funds to cover an outgoing direct debit, the direct debit will bounce and you’ll be charged a €3 fee** from your main account. Please note, it is not possible to go into an overdraft within a Space.*For Non-Euro countries only: If you are setting up a direct debit with a merchant in your home currency, it's the receiving bank who dictates the currency exchange and the ultimate amount that is collected from us. You can check the list of countries below:BulgariaCroatiaCzech RepublicDenmarkHungaryIcelandLiechtensteinNorwayPolandRomaniaSwedenSwitzerland

question: Wie bekomme ich ein P-Konto?
answer: Befolge bitte diese Schritte, um ein P-Konto zu beantragen: Fülle dieses Formular (neuen Tab) aus und unterschreibe esSchicke das Formular von deiner bei uns registrierten E-Mail-Adresse an support@n26.com (neuen Tab).Alternativ kannst du uns das Formular auch direkt über die App zukommen lassen. Antworte dazu einfach auf die Nachricht, in der wir dich über die Pfändung informiert haben.Bitte beachte:Wir melden der Schufa Holding AG die Umwandlung in ein P-Konto.Wenn du dich für ein P-Konto entscheidest, müssen wir bei Aktivierung des Pfändungsschutzes (d. h. bei einer aktiven Pfändung) deinen Dispokredit und Kredit kündigen.Du darfst nur ein P-Konto haben. Mehrere P-Konten (auch bei anderen Banken) zu nutzen ist nicht erlaubt und kann zu einer außerordentlichen, fristlosen Kündigung deines N26 Kontos führen.

question: Warum kann ich keine anderen N26 MoneyBeam Nutzer sehen?
answer: Um Echtzeit-Transaktionen wie MoneyBeams durchzuführen, überprüft N26 die Kontaktliste deines Smartphones und findet andere N26 Nutzer anhand der gespeicherten Telefonnummer oder E-Mail-Adresse. Wenn jemand erkannt wurde, siehst du das an dem blauen Punkt neben seinem Namen.Wenn du die Namen deiner Freunde in der MoneyBeam-Liste nicht siehst, aber weißt, dass sie N26 Nutzer sind, haben sie sich höchstwahrscheinlich nicht sichtbar gemacht. Du kannst auch wählen, ob du selbst dich für andere N26 Nutzer sichtbar oder unsichtbar machen möchtest.Wenn ein MoneyBeam zwischen N26 Nutzern scheitert, liegt es wahrscheinlich daran, dass bei einem oder beiden Nutzern mehrere Telefonnummern oder E-Mail-Adressen im Profil in der Kontaktliste gespeichert sind. Stelle sicher, dass du die aktuelle E-Mail-Adresse und Telefonnummer deiner Freunde in deinem Handy abgespeichert hast, um ihnen MoneyBeams zu senden. Wenn die in deinem Handy gespeicherten Kontaktdaten nicht stimmen, kannst du keinen MoneyBeam senden.Du willst deinen Freunden von uns erzählen und gleichzeitig Geld verdienen? Erfahre mehr über unser Freunde-Empfehlungsprogramm.

question: What if my balance is negative?
answer: If you have an overdraft, your balance can be negative as long as you stay within your overdraft limit.Your balance can also become negative if you have to pay N26 fees, e.g., for our express delivery or our premium memberships. Furthermore, your balance can become negative if an offline card payment is received and needs to be debited. These could be, for instance, payments made on aircraft or ships, which were not taken from your balance at the time of payment authorization but must still be debited. In accordance with our terms and conditions, you are obligated to balance your account. You will receive a reminder via email and we ask that you balance your account as quickly as possible. You cannot make any further payments or withdrawals while your balance is negative.What happens if my balance remains negative?Your account will remain active for 60 days from the date your balance becomes negative. During this period:You will receive two reminders.If you have an overdraft, it will be canceled after the second reminder and you will have to repay the amount immediately (or you can apply for a repayment plan).If you have an N26 You, N26 Metal or N26 Business You account, all services will be canceled after 60 days and your account will be converted into a standard account.Once this 60-day period has passed, we are entitled to close your account if you have still not taken action to rectify your negative balance.

question: How to earn money by inviting friends to N26?
answer: From 1st October 2021 we have started to rework and improve our Friend Referral program. Until these changes have been completed, we have removed this information from the app. Invites and sign-ups before the 1st October will still be paid out as before. We do not have a current time frame on when we will be back to offering sign-up referrals.*Currently our friend referral program is only active in Germany and Austria (new tab) as well as in Spain (new tab).

question: Kann ich die N26 App auf mein Smartphone herunterladen?
answer: Jede App-Version kann ab Veröffentlichung 180 Tage lang verwendet werden. Innerhalb dieses Zeitraums werden neuere Versionen zur Verfügung gestellt. Bitte führe immer ein Upgrade auf die jeweils neueste Version durch, um stets von einem optimalen Kundenerlebnis zu profitieren. Die neueste Version der N26 App kannst du im Apple App Store (neuen Tab) oder im Google Play Store (neuen Tab) herunterladen.Bitte beachte, dass es für alle Smartphones Mindestanforderungen gibt, um eine ordnungsgemäße Nutzung zu gewährleisten. Diese Anforderungen sind unten aufgelistet:iPhone:Modell 5s und neueriOS 12 und höherDeine iOS-Version kannst du unter Einstellungen > Allgemein > InfoAndroid:Android 6.0 oder höher. Du findest deine Android-Version unter Einstellungen > Über dein GerätNative Unterstützung für Google ServicesDu willst deinen Freunden von uns erzählen und gleichzeitig Geld verdienen? Erfahre mehr über unser Freunde-Empfehlungsprogramm (neuen Tab).

question: Why was I charged a Gambling Fee?
answer: The Gambling Fee to the amount of 3% applies to all private customers who registered for an account after March 12, 2020, or who have a Business membership plan (regardless of the date on which said plan took effect).Customers with such a membership plan are charged the Gambling Fee when making use of the services of the following gambling providers:LotteriesSports bettingOnline casinosHorse racingOther gambling activitiesPlease note that this includes both incoming and outgoing applicable Mastercard transactions. The 3% Gambling Fee is charged after the applicable transaction is processed. For example: if you win or convert your remaining chips back to money, the merchant will send the balance in another transaction where the 3% Gambling Fee will be charged again.Good to know:The 3% Gambling Fee appears on your transaction list and balance statement, linked to the original and any subsequent transaction from the gambling merchant.The fee we have charged is related to Mastercard transactions you’ve processed at certain relevant merchants (no matter which country you place the bet) and can’t be refunded. Some of our customers will not have to pay the Gambling Fee, as a result of the ruling of the Federal Court of Justice of Germany (BGH XI ZR 26/20).

question: Come creare una password?
answer: Se hai dimenticato la password oppure vuoi cambiarla, seleziona Dimenticata? nella versione mobile dell'app o Password dimenticata? nella WebApp (nuova tabella) nella fase di accesso. Ti invieremo un link all’indirizzo e-mail registrato per creare una nuova password. La password non deve rispondere a requisiti specifici ma ne verrà valutata la sicurezza nel momento in cui viene creata: verranno accettate le password considerate sicure dal nostro algoritmo.Raccomandiamo l'utilizzo di una combinazione di parole piuttosto che l'uso di un'unica parola: segui la logica del "difficile da indovinare ma facile da ricordare".Se la tua password non viene accettata dal nostro sistema, puoi inserire caratteri speciali, numeri oppure una combinazione di lettere maiuscole e minuscole.Se inserisci una password errata per sei volte consecutive, l'accesso al conto verrà temporaneamente bloccato. In tal caso, prova a collegarti nuovamente dopo 30 minuti.La chat è disponibile da lunedì a domenica dalle 07:00 alle 23:00.

question: What to do if my account may be compromised?
answer:
Fraud hotline - Contact us.Have you made a SEPA or SWIFT transfer to a fraudster who has an N26 IBAN? Call us!
+49 30 22957300. Service hours: Mo. - Fr. 9:00 - 18:00. Please note, our fraud hotline only handles the described cases of fraud! If you have different issues or questions, please contact our customer service.Please note that N26 will never call you from this number. If you do receive a call that appears to be from this number, please do not answer as this is a third party imitating N26.If you believe your account may be compromised, first change your password, then there are some actions you can take in different situations:What should I do if I spot a suspicious transaction on my account?If you notice a suspicious transaction, refer to our article on How to dispute a transaction?Then contact our Customer Support team, either directly through the N26 app, or by emailing support@n26.com (new tab). If you’d rather speak on the phone, you can request this during the chat. We’ll arrange a callback within the hour so we can discuss the matter further with you. Once in contact with one of our agents, please thoroughly explain the situation to us. Every detail here is important. 
Please be assured that we’ll take all necessary measures to assist you in this situation. In addition to our legal obligations for fraud prevention, and in order to continually improve our security safeguards, we have a dedicated team who analyzes each fraud case individually. The fraud cases themselves are often relatively complicated and have to be dealt with in detail. Depending on the complexity, this can take a few days, but in some cases it can take several weeks.Finally, if you have evidence or strong feelings that the account might have been hacked, we recommend that you file a police report as well.What should I do if I’ve lost my card, or believe that my card details may have been compromised?If your N26 card has been lost, stolen or you believe your card details have been compromised, you should lock your card immediately in your N26 app, and reorder a new one to keep your money safe. What if I’ve lost my paired device? Could someone access my account?If your paired device is lost or stolen, rest assured that your N26 app can only be accessed when the right password is entered, or with fingerprint or facial recognition. Our customer service team will be able to assist you in pairing a new device to your N26 account when you have one. Where can I learn more about security at N26?To learn more about how we protect your account in case of fraud, visit our blog article (new tab). Visit our page about Security at N26 (new tab) to discover our commitment to protect your funds and your account.Chat is available everyday from 07:00-23:00 including Sundays and bank holidays.If you do not have access to your N26 mobile app or your N26 webapp login, you can also request to block your card or account by calling us at +44 2035 107126 or +49 303 6428 6881 (both lines in English) .

question: Mastercard Travel Rewards - France
answer: Mastercard Travel Rewards vous permet d'économiser pendant que vous voyagez. Avec des centaines de remises sous forme de cashback dans 17 pays, vous pouvez obtenir un remboursement automatique sur vos sorties culturelles, vos achats, les restaurants, les hôtels et plus encore lorsque vous payez avec votre Mastercard N26 à l'étranger.Où puis-je trouver les offres ?Lorsque vous vous connectez à votre application N26, appuyez simplement sur la rubrique Découvrir pour accéder à toutes les offres en cours. Attention : pour le moment, le programme Mastercard Travel Rewards n'est disponible que pour les clients N26 résidant en France et faisant leurs achats à l'étranger.Cliquez ici (nouvel onglet) pour consulter la liste des commerçants participant à ce programme.Comment puis-je bénéficier de ces remises ?Si vous souhaitez bénéficier des offres proposées par Mastercard Travel Rewards, il vous suffit de payer avec votre carte N26 dans les commerces participants à l'étranger. Vous recevrez ensuite le remboursement correspondant à l'offre sur votre compte N26 dans un délai de 30 jours suivant la date d'achat.Veuillez noter : Mastercard Travel Rewards est uniquement disponible pour les titulaires de comptes N26 Smart, You et Metal.

question: What is a N26 Business Account?
answer: N26 Business is a simple and affordable solution for all your daily financial business needs. The N26 Business account is a safe and intuitive digital business current account that you can sign up to in minutes. It is beautifully simple, transparent and free*; allowing you to receive payments from clients, send money and spend confidently while keeping your business finances completely separate from your personal ones.Our business accounts are designed for self-employed and freelancers doing business under their own name (meaning you can’t have our company name on your account or card). It is currently not possible to switch from personal to business accounts, so make sure that this account is right for you before opening.What are the benefits of a N26 Business Account?Our N26 Business account comes with the following benefits and features:Free* business account: N26 Business is free to open online with no account management fees (*after a balance of €50,000 or higher a deposit fee (new tab) may apply).Virtual card: The account comes with a free virtual card intended for business use only. The virtual card has a full PAN number and is ready to add to your Apple or Google wallets for online and in-store purchases. You can also use contactless-enabled ATMs to withdraw money with Apple or Google pay.Physical N26 Mastercard: For an additional €10, you can receive a physical N26 Mastercard for business use (please note, you will need to have at least €10 available in your account to trigger card production and shipment).Maestro card: If you also need a card for private expenses then customers with DE, AT and NL T&C’s, can order a Maestro card for an additional €10.Payments & Transfers: You can send and receive SEPA transfers using your N26 mobile app. Additionally, you can send money instantly to other N26 customers using Moneybeam. Unlike other accounts, transfers in foreign currencies aren’t possible with N26 Business within the app. You can visit Wise (new tab) for this.Business cashback: You receive 0.1% cashback every month on all payments made using the card.What are the maximum limits for N26 Business accounts?The maximum daily payment limits for the N26 Business Mastercard (total amount within 24 hours) are: ATM withdrawals: €2,500	In-store or online payments: €5,000 The monthly limit for payments is €20,000. You can set your limits (new tab) for ATM withdrawals and payments directly in the Cards section of the app.On top of this, if you open an N26 Business You or N26 Business Metal account in Germany, Austria, or the Netherlands, you can apply for a Maestro card for your personal expenses The maximum daily limits (within 24 hours) for bank transfers are: MoneyBeam to N26 customers: €1,000Instant transfers: €100,000Outgoing transfers: No limits N26 Business doesn't support transfers in foreign currencies (new tab) made from the app but directly from the Wise (new tab) website. Please note that business-to-business (B2B) payments are not supported with a N26 Business account.

question: How to file a complaint?
answer: Looking for support or have a question?If you need assistance with your account, card payment disputes, changing your data, or just want to ask a question, find out how to contact N26 here.Raising a complaintWe’re sorry you wish to raise a complaint and will thoroughly investigate it. We'll provide our findings and final response via email. Our customer support team can help you submit a complaint via live chat, otherwise please write to one of the following addresses, based on your preferred language:German beschwerden@n26.com (new tab)English complaints@n26.com (new tab)Please note: These inboxes are for filing a complaint only. Our customer support team (new tab) is available every day and may be able to resolve your issue sooner.When filing a complaint, please always include:A comprehensive description of the complaint and the affected service or productThe date on which the problem first occurredAny supporting documents to accompany your complaint (e.g screenshots, emails etc)Your preferred outcomeKindly note, we can only discuss account related matters from an email address registered to your N26 account. If the complaint is raised through a representative, it must also be accompanied by a special notarised power of attorney form.Please note: Only contact us via our app or via email, as we are unable to serve customers in person. If you cannot contact us via app or email, please send a written complaint (letters only) to the central postal address:N26 Complaint Management10026 BerlinWe’ll contact you via email to confirm that we’ve received your complaint and will begin our investigation. In case we need more information from you, we will reach out directly via email.Complaint handling timesAll complaints concerning payment services, such as transfers and card transactions will be resolved within 15 business days, per the European Payment Services Directive II (PSD2). If we need more time to assess your complaint, we will let you know but we must provide our response within 35 business days. For all other complaints, different time frames apply based on the country of your account Terms & Conditions.Germany and Austria - 15 Business Days Greater Europe - 15 Business DaysIreland - 40 Business DaysFrance - 56 Calendar Days United Kingdom - 56 Calendar Days Spain - 60 Calendar Days Italy - 60 Calendar Days We may close your complaint if we do not receive a response from you. If you reach out to us again at a later date, we will open a new file and provide a new complaint reference number.If you are unhappy with the outcome of your complaintIf you are not satisfied with our findings, you may wish to consider further advice from independent third parties, such as:An arbitration body via Deutsche Bundesbank (German Federal Bank)Bundesanstalt für Finanzdienstleistungsaufsicht – BaFin (German Federal Financial Supervisory Authority)For a full list of dispute resolution bodies, please see our Imprint (new tab) page.

question: How to block contactless payments on my card?
answer: Currently only available for iOS users on the mobile app.Contactless payments are really practical. But you might prefer to deactivate this payment method to prevent unauthorised transactions on your card. This is why you can now deactivate contactless payments on your card specifically:Go to Cards. If you have multiple cards, swipe to the right until you see the card you want.Tap Card settings.Toggle Contactless payments.The changes you make are applied instantly to the card you’ve chosen. Keep in mind that these settings refer to your physical card. You can read our dedicated articles to manage your Google Pay and Apple Pay settings. If you’re experiencing difficulties with contactless card payments, please read the following article to learn how to make them work.

question: How do contactless payments work?
answer: Contactless payments on your card function through near field communication (NFC). Learn If you’re experiencing issues with contactless payments, keep the following in mind:Check if contactless payments are enabled in your card settings.If your card is new, be sure that you used it at an ATM or with Chip & PIN before. Only then you can use it for contactless payments, too.Contactless payments on your card (NFC) up to €50 don’t require a card PIN. For amounts over €50 or cumulative transactions above 150€ you’ll need to enter your card PIN. Ask the merchant if the payment terminal actually supports contactless payments.N26 Metal cards only have NFC on the back side of the card. Make sure to hold the back side of the card against the terminal to use NFC (using the front won’t work).Make sure your card is held directly onto the NFC-compatible surface of the payment terminal. If you remove your card too fast or didn’t hold it close enough, just try again.If contactless is not working, please always try to use the Chip & PIN method to complete your payment.

question: What are “Messages” ?
answer:
The security of your personal data is our priority. That’s why we created an inbox in the N26 app that allows us to share any communication. Any content that includes personal data is communicated in Messages. We’ll still use your email address to communicate general information.What is personal data?Personal data is any information that relates to you as a person and identifies or could possibly identify you. It could be your account details, your address (email or postal), ID documents, proof of residence, but also the notification about your accrued overdraft interest or your monthly standing order.
How does it work? When we send you a message to Messages, you’ll receive a push notification on your paired smartphone and an email to your registered email address. Once connected to the Webapp, you’ll also be notified by an info card of any new messages.We’ll send you a message that you can find in your Messages from N26, and ask that you reply directly from there.This feature is available in our mobile app, by clicking on the Support icon on the top right hand corner. Make sure you downloaded the latest app version. You can’t initiate a conversation, but you’ll be able to reply as soon as we send you the first message.
